This is a 20 x 24 inch, Battlemap of a Swamp Patrol Outpost , it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“We take out the guards at the outpost first, steal their motorboats, then hit a bigger base down the swamp river one klick to the east. “—Rebel Commander

Swamp Patrol Outpost is a single level exterior map of a brown swamp or muddy river surrounded by a lush green jungle. The swamp could be a lake or a river that extends off the map to the east. There are two wooden cabins for two people each built on top of stilts on the beach with two docked motorboats in the swamp next to a small pier.

Swamp Patrol Outpost is intended for use in pulp, horror, and modern games. The motorboats on the map came into production at the end of the 19th century and beginning of the 20th century. This sets the range of this map in the 20th century to the present time wise.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Revolution beginning in a Still Swamp: The Player Characters have been hired as mercenaries by a rebel group attempting a military coup against a draconian dictator. The rebel commander instructs them to ambush the guards of a small swamp patrol outpost at the end of a swampy river, steal their motorboats, and use them to move eastward and assault a bigger base on the way to the dictator’s palace.

204109.name: A Collection of Creatures
204109.description:
From publisher blurb:

Contained within are a few creatures to add to your 5th Edition campaigns.

Inside you will find the following beasts:
Ashen Wolf, Barbtail Monkey, Horned Howler, Mindripper Sabercat, Mirewhisper Serpent, the Thunder Drake, and the Volturax.

204110.name: Johnny Graves - The Unchosen One
204110.description:
It’s 1979 in New York. Johnny Graves is a former agent of Hell and Satan needs him back desperately to finish the job he started over two centuries ago. Now fire spitting, giant spiders and an army of dead are after him to bring Johnny back to the fold. Johnny has one night to close the gates of Hell and prevent Satan himself from coming across the mortal divide.

Source: The Developer Website.

204111.name: Viscera Cleanup Detail: House of Horror!
204111.description:
Long ago in the early 1990's, on a gloomy Halloween night in an old, cursed house, a wicked force began to stir. Foolish mortals dabbled in things they did not understand and could not comprehend. Evil was unleashed. The hapless fools that brought chaos back into the world were slaughtered..

And now it falls to you to set things right. You must wash away the stains of evil. So get your mop ready once more and clean this mess up!

The "House of Horror" DLC features a whole new level set in a haunted suburban home and surrounding grounds, complete with new assets and challenges to discover and overcome.

Source: The Game Website.

204112.name: Super Mega Neo Pug
204112.description:
User Summary

Like its predecessor Turbo Pug, you control a Pug dog, but this time clicking the mouse to keep it airborne. Colliding with object brings sudden death, while hitting various items grants shields and multi-coloured weapons.

204113.name: Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage
204113.description:
Tragedy! Santa; the toy giving folk-hero, and purveyor of fine Christmas goods, has had enough. Endless requests from greedy children wanting more and more every year, tax increases, pressure from elf unions, bills, reindeer!

It is your duty, as an employee of Polar Sanitation Inc, to clean up the grizzly aftermath of Santa's bloody rampage. Elves, reindeer and ruined masonry from Santa's brief breakdown are all strewn across his famous workshop.

So don your cap, grab your mop, and get this place sorted out so the company can get a replacement in here ASAP, and restore Christmas for another generation!

Source: The Game Website.

204114.description:
Some vampires are beautiful, sophisticated immortals that teenagers swoon over. Galok is NOT that type of vampire. His appearance is as revolting as his evil, twisted soul. But, he is still of great use to the Necros Cult, eliminating their enemies and capturing fresh victims for sacrificial rituals.

This is an exclusive promo for Hero Realms Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.
204114.name: Hero Realms: Galok, the Vile Promo Card

204115.description:
This kit allows players to examine the initial stages of the campaign with the extra mapsheets and the four-page scenario booklet. The 11x34 map adds Charleroi and the Sambre river to the South for the "Opening Round" of the campaign and the 22" x 34" map adds the approach to Brussels and the valley of the Dyle to the North for the final move on Brussels. If the allied army had been obliged to fall back from Waterloo, the roads from Braine-l'Alleud, from Waterloo, and from Wavre, meet at a very excellent position about a mile and a half in front of Brussels.

(from OSG's product description)
204115.name: Napoleon's Last Gamble Expansion Kit: The Highway to Brussels

204116.name: Broskams
204116.description:
An alien race known as the Broskams have just finished their annual winter hibernation and there is only one thing on their minds, to get out of the hibernation cave and get some warmth!

Broskams is a 2-4 player card drafting, simultaneous action selection, tile laying and tile manipulation game that takes place over four rounds. The player with the most warmth points (victory points) at the end of the fourth round is the winner of the game!

At the beginning of each round, every player receives 6 cards that represents the different Broskams and each of their special powers. The players will draft these cards one at a time and pass the remaining to the players on their left (and right depending on the round) until they have a new hand of 6 cards. After that, the players will choose one of their 6 cards and reveal them simultaneously. Then, starting with the first player, everyone will use the card they revealed to either place one of their Broskams onto the board (leave the cave) or use the special ability printed on the card, moving their Broskams closer to the sun for more warmth points!

204117.name: Middleware
204117.description:
There’s not really a night any more, just like there’s not really a day. There’s just a now, and the endless cycling of machines that tell us when to meet with who and where. We are the people existing here, under the overlapping influence of two great powers, stranded between the Corporations.

We’re the Middleware.

Middleware is a cooperative cyberpunk deck-building game where you and your friends are trying to hack, assault, overload and manipulate your way into the monstrous servers of two overlapping corporate supercomputers, and seize control of your own existence. Fail, and you risk being trapped in the system forever.
- Choose one of four unique characters, each with their own struggles and objectives.
- Organise daring raids on corporate supercomputers that become more dangerous the closer you get to winning.
- Build your resources to cram your deck full of your favourite tactics.
- Bring yourself and up to three friends. Work together to smash the servers! Players win when they crack all layers of both servers.
- Build up massive debt to buy powerful cards – you can always pay your upkeep next turn. What’s the worst that could happen? If everyone goes above their max the players lose.
Enough neon to choke a cyborg.

204118.name: The Blackrock Brothers Abroad
204118.description:
From the introduction:

Even though moral turpitude is one of the defining characteristics of hill giant nature, there are still a few rules that all hill giants follow; rules like "The Clan Chief is Always Right", or "Don't Throw Boulders at the Shaman While He's Meditating". These simple codes of conduct allow the members of a hill giant clan to live together, if not in harmony, at least in partially controlled anarchy. In this respect, the Blackrock clan was much the same as any other hill giant tribe, and like other tribes there were some members that were less inclined to follow the rules than others. In the Blackrock clan, the prime troublemakers were the brothers Snagtooth and Bearbreath, named for their distinctive dental features and culinary tastes respectively. Ever since they were old enough to throw rocks, these two had been a plague on the rest of the clan. Even other hill giants considered them to be lazy, bothersome pests. It came as no surprise then when they were caught breaking the tribe's most sacrosanct rule: "Never Steal the Clan Chief's Favorite Club".

User summary:

For characters of 3rd - 5th level

204119.name: Bloodbane Keep
204119.description:
From the introduction:

The adventurers must decide how to rescue a group of kidnapped children from a remote and well-protected castle, and what to do with them afterwards.

User summary:

For characters of level 7th - 9th. This scenario requires tactical proficiency and good strategic planning. Note this adventure was written as a sequel to The School of Nekros published in Dungeon (Issue 27 - Jan 1991).

204120.name: The Temple of the Chained Demon
204120.description:
From the introduction:

This is a two-quest campaign. The first quest involves rescuing a princess from a tower controlled by an evil wizard, the second quest involves reaching a certain temple before the wizard's brother can free the Demon locked inside of it.

User summary:

An adventure for 4th - 8th level characters (at least one must be a wizard). The adventure has been archived in a ZIP containing two files and two images (maps).

204121.name: The Black Pyramid of the Ancient Cloakers
204121.description:
From the introduction:

One year ago the brother of Knoedag, Aldari received the last letter that Knoedag had written ten years ago.

Based on this letter and the long period he hasn’t been contacted by Knoedag, Aldari has come to the conclusion that Knoedag is in trouble. Aldari, being a simple furniture-maker decided to find a group of heroes that would be able to find his brother.

User summary:

For a party of 8th level characters.

204122.name: The Demon's Return
204122.description:
From the introduction:

Many years ago, in ages past when the gods of humanity were starting to grow in power, there rose among the population of Karaken, a cult dedicated to the shunned goddess of death, Pestula. The leaders of this movement were primarily cleric/magic-users whose ultimate goal was to place a chosen one of their goddess upon the throne of the land. They succeeded in infiltrating the royal household and in one dark, evil evening, killed the entire royal family and made of their deaths an offering to the goddess. Pestula responded by taking unto herself one of her male followers and begetting of him a cambion of great power who was called by men Zagaroth, the despoiler. Through the power of Pestula, Zagaroth was born full into his own power and strength and was placed upon the throne of Karaken.

User summary:

For characters level 6th - 10th

204123.name: Dhowin's Rest
204123.description:
From the introduction:

Dhowin's Rest itself is a low mound that anywhere else could be missed by casual travelers. On the bleak Plains of Yhaunn the mound draws the eye like a magnet. It is about 10 paces wide by some 15 paces long and egg shaped. Grass grows thickly on its smooth surface. Near the southern end there is a small depression where a few stones protrude like bones picked clean by the ravens that circle constantly looking for stray sheep or goats.

User summary:

For mid-level characters. A set of six GIF map files usually circulated with this scenario.

204124.name: Disaster Within
204124.description:
From the introduction:

Disaster Within is an AD&D adventure intended for six to eight dwarven player characters of levels 6-9 (about 55-60 total levels). The party should include at least one cleric, a few strong fighter types and be of neutral or good alignment. The party should be one that works well together. The entire adventure is set in a vast northern mountain range, home to a remote kingdom of dwarves; known as the "Halls of Thorlin".

204125.name: The Displaced (1998)
204125.description:
From the introduction:

The Displaced is an AD&D adventure for 4-6 player characters of levels 5-7 (about 30 total levels). The module can be easily placed into any existing campaign. The characters should be of good alignment. A dwarf or a character with the mining proficiency would definitely be an asset here.

204126.name: The Botch
204126.description:
“In the criminal underworld, there are good days and there are bad days. Today, everyone is having a bad day.”

In The Botch, a motley collection of criminals are picking through the wreckage of a massive heist gone massively cock-eyed. There’s a fortune’s worth of diamonds flying around between the hands of even the small-timer crooks scudding around the Boss’ empire, and she’s not happy.

Meant to evoke those chaotic crime movies where everything’s going wrong, The Botch is a party game of hidden information and ridiculous messes. It’s a game about bluffing and nerve, about pulling off a con, and about grabbing the jewels and running. In The Botch, you’re going to lie, cheat and steal, and if you’re really lucky you’ll get out of this with your skin intact.

The Botch is a hidden-information bluffing game designed to keep things reasonably chaotic and make it hard for players to get an overwhelming edge through experience and memorisation. It’s a game to get people into gaming, where things going embarrassingly wrong is part of the design.

The Botch contains 5 Basic roles and 5 Basic items, which are designed to be played as an entry-level stable game. As you become more comfortable with the game you can add more roles and more items, choosing from an additional 7 Advanced roles and 7 Advanced items.

First to 10 diamonds ends the game or last alive wins.

204127.name: Ecclesias' Bane
204127.description:
From the introduction:

Ecclesias is, or rather was, a reclusive wizard who lived in a large manor house set deep in a sylvan forest. Several years ago, he noticed that the young daughter of his cook seemed to have the potential to become a competent wizard and so took her on as his apprentice. Since then she has advanced to the sixth level of mastery and has proven to be quite adept at her craft.

User summary:

For characters of 3rd - 5th level

204128.name: Village of Eirie
204128.description:
From the introduction:

Eirie was once a peaceful village like many other boring peaceful villages. Established by settlers from the civilized city states, the small farming settlement that traded with the then friendly natives grew into a small village. A missionary priest built a small chapel in which he taught the true gods to the natives. Then one day, Goopsa the necromancer came to town. Disguised as a retired merchant, he bought the village's only inn and became a distinguished citizen of the village. However, his real purpose for coming to the village was to find a great power trapped in the well of Carkinaxital.

User summary:

For characters of 5th - 7th level

204129.name: Lily X Blade
204129.description:
The many prestigious high schools of Jordan Ketch Prefecture feature countless clubs for proper young ladies. A girl can try her hand at nearly anything, from flower arranging to water polo.

What they don’t offer is swordplay – but that’s about to change.

Rules are drawn up. Blades cross in secret. And special badges now identify those girls ready to duel any place, any time…

Lily x Blade is a two-player, player-versus-player card game with simple rules and a whole lot of bluffing.

- Choose your tactics, then fool your rival so she plays right into your hands! choosing a card from you hand of 5 and revealing at the same time as your opponent.
- Capture your rival’s cards to limit her options and press the advantage. Rock paper scissors but with special abilities on some cards.
- Each duelist has a unique personality and abilities – choose your favourite and ensure her ultimate victory! First to five wins, wins!

204130.name: Buccaneer
204130.description:
User summary:

A hack 'n' slash game where you play a pirate fighting zombies and other monsters to try and collect gold.

204131.name: Threshold (Issue 12 - Jul 2016) Ages Past
rpgissuearticle: Erkalion – The Dusk of an Empire
Hesperia, Land of the Setting Sun
Koskatep Level 10: Intitepetl, Gem of the Sun
Past Ages of the Known World
The Lost Origins of the Elves
204131.description:
From the back cover:

The past can come alive!

Ancient empires, horrors, miracles, catastrophes... Mystara's past is a rich treasure trove of such experiences, just waiting to be plundered. Most Player Characters learn about history from musty scrolls and crumbling clay tablets... but no more. Now they can live through those ancient mysteries directly.

Within these pages you will find adventures that span from mere decades before the modern era, all the way to the remote beginnings of humankind itself. While Geoff Gander and OldDawg explore two of the oldest human empires, LoZompatore delves into the origin of the elves. Other articles focus on darker times, in ancient Taymora, and we even delve into the past of the Mystaran community itself in an interview with James Mishler.

Even more can be found within, for this isn't the end of the story. Nor is it the beginning. You can always go... further back...

204132.name: Guess What + Who
204132.description:
This board game includes 6 exciting games that both children and older ones, will love. It will provide many hours of fun and laughter for the whole family and friends.

Who? Everyone knows what/who you are but you... Make smart questions to find it.
Who/What you think you are? Find the person or object the others wrote on your card.
What? Describe the content of the card
Guess! Find the hidden person or animal
Four: Create a pile of 4 cards and place your hand above them asap
What is missing: Find what is missing and place it on the correct line

204133.name: Handsket
204133.description:
It's the New Basketball Dexterity Game that have never been before . The idea for the game is gained from the coin basketball.

You can dribble, pass, shoot and put the ball through the rim. Score 21 points to win with strategic and efficient arrangement!

"The more you practice, the better you will become."

204135.name: Skyjo
204135.description:
Every player has 12 hidden cards (3x4). Two are turned face up. On your turn you can take the top card from the discard or draw pile. You can exchange one card (hidden or open) from your display. Round ends when one player has only open cards. (equal turns). All card will be revealed. Add the numbers of the card for scoring. Game ends after one player has 100 or more points. Whoever has the lowest number wins.

Special rule: Whenever one column of 3 cards all have the same value, they will be discarded and no longer scored.

Cards are ranked from -2 up to 12

204136.name: Beyond the Gates of Antares: The Battle for Xilos
204136.description:
Once again penned by game author Rick Priestley, the supplement continues the events from the main rulebook - triggered by the discovery of the planet of Xilos.

The book describes, in the form of an exciting and continuing narrative, the struggle for control of the planet and the ancient builder tech hidden beneath its surface - and includes a campaign system featuring a series of scenarios which cover the different stages of the battle for Xilos, from the initial landings to... well, we'll come onto that... with a cool system for gathering campaign victory points and fielding some of the strange builder tech artefacts that your forces will capture along the way!
Packed with new rules!

Battle for Xilos also includes a whole raft of new content - including the likes of rules for including allies and mercenaries in your force as well as new army lists for the Ghar Outcast Rebels, and the mercenary forces of the Freeborn Adventurers and Boromite Clans, not to mention a host of special characters, new troop types, new weapons and vehicles, and some rather scary native creatures.

++ Classified IMTel*++

6 New Scenarios.
Complete Campaign System, inclusive of force and character progression.
Rules on how to build your own characters.
New rules for incorporating allies either by combining forces or with mercenaries.
Xilos creature rules.
One Completely new Ghar Outcast Rebel Army.
Two new Mercenary army lists, The Freeborn Adventurers Army and the Boromite Clan Army.
Army list updates for Isorians and Algoyrn.
New Characters.
New troop types including Isorian Pulse Bikes, new Drone types, Ghar Outcast Support weapons and the Rebel Creeper...

204137.description:
The Log Bay - Bonus Adventure for Chada & Thorn

In this 8 pages PDF file you will find a bonus adventure for Chada & Thorn, developed by Gerhard Hecht.

(From the original site:
http://legenden-von-andor.de/die-treibholzbucht-bonus-abente... )
204137.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn - Die Treibholzbucht

204138.description:
In this game, you can only win if you know how the opposite sex thinks. Explain the words and try to make it to the finish space first!

Men play on one team against women on the other team.

Each team takes turns trying to explain and guess words from the opposite teams wordcards. If they fail within the time limit, the other team gets a go at guessing the word.

Whoever guesses correct moves their pawn forwards on the track, trying to reach the finish space first

According to the publisher it is:

An outrageously fun version of the classic game!
The players get to use their imagination and sense of humour to win.
The hilarious content allows the fun to go on for a long time.
204138.name: Women vs. Men Alias

204140.description:
Whatever the government officials say, everyone knows that it is the Guild that truly rules the streets of Thandar. If you do business or commit crime within the city without paying the Guild its due, you can expect a visit from Droga or his associates.

This is an exclusive promo for Hero Realms Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.
204140.name: Hero Realms: Droga, Guild Enforcer Promo Card

204141.description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to Cat Town, a paradise for cats and cat lovers like you. On these lazy breezy days, you may see cats lying on the roof, inside the bushes, under the cars, or any other funny places they see fit. During your visit today, take a walk around the blocks to see how many cats you can find in Cat Town.

Cat Town combines memory, hand-management and deck-manipulation, with players scoring points in three ways: finding cats, collecting items, and playing Travel notes cards. To set up, shuffle the deck of Cat, Item, and Action cards, deal two cards to each player, then create four or six "blocks" of cards, based on the number of players. On a turn, a player takes one of four actions:


Move their cat token across one of the neighboring blocks, then add the top card on that block to their hand.
Move their cat token across one of the neighboring blocks, then reveal the top card on that block, keeping it in front of them if it's a Cat or Item and discarding it otherwise.
Playing an Item or Action card for the effect described in the text, then taking the action shown on the bonus icon.
Revealing a card at random from their hand, keeping it in front of them if it's a Cat or Item and discarding it otherwise.


Each Cat in front of you as well as each pair of Items with the same name is worth 1 point. A Travel note played with three additional cards from the hand is also worth 1 points. The first player to score 6 points wins.
204141.name: Cat Town

204142.name: Cheers
boardgamepublisher: Play With Us Design (玩聚設計)
204142.description:
CHEERS is a light board game featuring teamwork, logical thinking, and scheming.
During the game, everyone plays as a mixologist, cooperates with their teammates to gather the secret formula before other teams to claim victory. However, some liquors might “CHEERS” when they are played. It is a test to players’ wisdom of how to CHEERS the liqours to victory or to hamper the opponents.
Moreover, the game can be played in 3 different modes, redering various CHEERS experiences for players to explore!

《乾杯 CHEERS》是一個合作、默契、推理以及心機攻防的桌上小品遊戲。
在遊戲中，每位玩家都會擔任調酒師，必須與隊友同心協力，率先完成自己的秘密配方，取得勝利！但在遊戲的過程中，部分酒類會和其他酒產生「乾杯」，而如何運用乾杯去達成勝利或阻撓對手，就考驗著玩家的智慧了！
此外，《乾杯 CHEERS》有三種不同的遊戲模式，每種模式都有不同的樂趣供玩家體驗！

204143.description:
Hexpanse is a fast, hexagon based tactical board game. In the game players are interstellar commanders and warlords who are battling for different planets. The players can win the game in two ways:
1. The player defeats the opponent’s commander(s).
2. The player builds up the 9 units long pattern (a unique formation) which is selected randomly from the pattern deck at the beginning of the game.

During the game the players basically use their own soldiers, however, if they want they can deploy characters and special ally faction units on the planet surface. They can also use special action cards to get more units, speed, wealth or fire power.

On every turn, the players do the following things in order:
1. Their wealth growth based on their influence.
2. The player can select 2 from the following actions:
- Place a unit or a character on the planet board
- Take a unit back from the planet board
- Take one of your units back from the waste.
- Attack with one of your units or characters.
- Increase your wealth.
- Increase your influence.
- Move your commander to an adjacent place by paying a heal point.
- Use your commander’s skill by paying a heal point.
- Heal your commander by 1.
3. Buy cards from the market.
4. Fill up the market up to 5 cards.
204143.name: Hexpanse

204144.name: Goals
rpgseries: Non-Player Cards: A System Agnostic Character Generator
204144.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born from the Non-Player Cards Kickstarter, which contains a total of 8 decks. This is the Goals deck.
Systemless and setting flexible, each card contains a unique entry, descriptive text and finally a speedpaint illustration done by our masterful artist Eren Arik.

The Goals deck is an excellent tool to create a character's ultimate desires or goals, giving them more depth and direction.

204145.name: Names
rpgseries: Non-Player Cards: A System Agnostic Character Generator
204145.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born from the Non-Player Cards Kickstarter, which contains a total of 8 decks. This is the Names deck.
Systemless and setting flexible, each card contains a unique entry, descriptive text and finally a speedpaint illustration done by our masterful artist Eren Arik.

The Names deck consists of 35 name list cards and 15 name fragments to make your own names, Perfect for any GM or Player thats looking to spice up their characters or campaigns!

204146.name: Personalities
rpgseries: Non-Player Cards: A System Agnostic Character Generator
204146.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born from the Non-Player Cards Kickstarter, which contains a total of 8 decks. This is the Personalities deck.
Systemless and setting flexible, each card contains a unique entry, descriptive text and finally a speedpaint illustration done by our masterful artist Eren Arik.

The Personalities deck is an excellent tool to help

204147.name: Professions
rpgseries: Non-Player Cards: A System Agnostic Character Generator
204147.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born from the Non-Player Cards Kickstarter, which contains a total of 8 decks. This is the Professions deck.
Systemless and setting flexible, each card contains a unique entry, descriptive text and finally a speedpaint illustration done by our masterful artist Eren Arik.

The profession deck can help you answer the most common basic question your character or NPC may be asked, “What do you do?” and with these cards they can come to life . Is the character an innkeeper, an assassin, or maybe an herbalist? The professions deck provides a wide range of jobs and occupations for your NPCs.

Perfect for any GM or Player thats looking to spice up their characters or campaigns!

204148.name: Quirks
rpgseries: Non-Player Cards: A System Agnostic Character Generator
204148.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born from the Non-Player Cards Kickstarter, which contains a total of 8 decks. This is the Quirks deck.
Systemless and setting flexible, each card contains a unique entry, descriptive text and finally a speedpaint illustration done by our masterful artist Eren Arik.

The Quirks deck is an excellent tool to help make each interaction with the character to be truly colorful.

204149.name: Relationships
rpgseries: Non-Player Cards: A System Agnostic Character Generator
204149.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born from the Non-Player Cards Kickstarter, which contains a total of 8 decks. This is the Relationships deck.
Systemless and setting flexible, each card contains a unique entry, descriptive text and finally a speedpaint illustration done by our masterful artist Eren Arik.

The Relationships deck is an excellent tool to make connections between PCs or NPCs in a campaign/story.

204150.name: Secrets
rpgseries: Non-Player Cards: A System Agnostic Character Generator
204150.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born from the Non-Player Cards Kickstarter, which contains a total of 8 decks. This is the Secrets deck.
Systemless and setting flexible, each card contains a unique entry, descriptive text and finally a speedpaint illustration done by our masterful artist Eren Arik.

The Secrets deck is an excellent tool make something that the character would like to keep hidden. This may be somthing that guilts them or may require them to maintain their secrets.

204151.name: Traits
rpgseries: Non-Player Cards: A System Agnostic Character Generator
204151.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born from the Non-Player Cards Kickstarter, which contains a total of 8 decks. This is the Traits deck.
Systemless and setting flexible, each card contains a unique entry, descriptive text and finally a speedpaint illustration done by our masterful artist Eren Arik.

The Traits deck is an excellent tool to help make each character very different by adding a tangible noticable difference which may make them stick out from other 'average' persons.

204152.name: Encounter Decks: Science Fiction
204152.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need science fiction adventure ideas including ways to get the adventure started, several possible encounters along the way, and a couple of follow-up possibilities? Use our Encounter Decks: Science Fiction!

Each card helps you build a dynamic adventure!

Draw a card for an adventure outline. The outline includes backstory, ways to get the PCs involved, encounter possibilities, and follow-up ideas. The other side of the card is the most important map for that adventure. Need more maps? Borrow one from another card.

Each adventure in this deck has a Science Fiction theme/setting. However each card also has a note on how to turn it into a fantasy adventure. Encounter Decks are perfect for stocking a hex crawl or developing a side trek on the fly, or even chain several together for an entire campaign!

204155.name: The Guild Companion (Jul 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Cultures of the Age of Empires
HARP Folkways Preview Excerpt: Urban Ways

204161.name: vs. Ghosts
204161.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghost Hunting was never so much fun! Welcome to the exciting world of Vs. Ghosts!

Using the VsM Engine created by Phillip Reed!

vs. Ghosts is a roleplaying game in which players suit up to battle strange hauntings in their neighborhoods while dealing with the mundane non-believers that try to prevent you from doing your job. Be it hotels, art museums, or even the classic haunted house, ghosts need busting and to be contained. This book contains everything that you and your friends will need to play. All you need are friends and two decks of normal playing cards!

Quick Start Rules to get you in the game in a flash!
Bestiary of strange ghosts and other haunts to hunt!
Plenty of adventure hooks to get you on your way to Ghost Hunting fame!




So, whom do you call when things go bump in the night? Ghost hunting with vs. Ghosts will make you feel good!

204163.name: Gary Vs The Monsters
204163.description:
From publisher blurb:

This ain't about brooding vampires, misunderstood werewolves, or repentant demons. This is about monsters that want to drink your blood, rip off your face, and eat your soul. The only thing that stands between the world and the Armies of Hell is you and your vast experience in the fast food industry. That plus a chainsaw, a shotgun, a six pack of brews, and some duct tape.

Includes four classes: The Survivor, The Normal, The Mystic, and the Psychic. Random Starting Equipment Tables. Plus classic campy horror movie monsters and more.

Gary vs The Monsters is an old school campy cinematic horror RPG based around the White Box rules of that most popular fantasy roleplaying game.

rpgitemversion: The Third Hand of the Devil
204164.name: The Third Hand of the Devil
204164.description:
Publisher blurb:

Dark clouds gather over the CSA/Mexican border.

Senator Warburton was the only hope to avoid a military confrontation - but now he's gone missing somewhere between Houston and Dallas, while he was on his way to Roswell peace talks.

Only one man could still save two nations from a mindless war.

But Bigfoot Blutarski, The Third Hand of the Devil, is locked up in an Arkansas jail, waiting to be hanged as a cattle-rustler.

And even should someone pull him out of there, there's people ready for anything to stop him from getting to Roswell in time.

204165.name: Connections Card Game
204165.description:
Description from the publisher:

The 'Connections Card' Game is all about conceptually connecting words found on adjacent cards. It can be described simply as a cross between Scrabble™ and Dominoes.

The game contains 124 cards with 496 English words. Each card has four family-friendly words (one per edge) and a point value between 1 and 5.

There are 17 ways to play the game.

In the basic Classic Mode, players compete to get the highest score by connecting related words. For example, TEACHER can be connected with STUDENT, SCHOOL, RESPECT, LEARNING, JOB as well as a dozen other words.

Hilarious dialog begins when someone attempts a dubious connection and has to “sell” it to the group. This makes it a game about connecting people.

This family and party game is for use at home and school as well as corporate office team building.

The compact box is suitable for travel, camp and cottage.

204166.name: Schemata
204166.description:
From the introduction:

It is with sincere joy and trepidation that I welcome you into the Five Orders of the Garden. My joy comes from the pleasure in welcoming another who will worship the glory and wonder of the Creator and His Garden. My trepidation comes from the knowledge that you are no ordinary brother or sister, and that your role will be more dangerous than others. Yet together, we shall worship the Creator by protecting the relics He chose to survive into our time.

While you have taken this role willingly, we still feel the need to thank you for your sacrifice. You have turned away from a life of simple contemplation and adoration in favor of risk and conflict. Please know that you will be in our daily prayers and that we truly appreciate your work for the Creator.

You will face many trials. Always keep the truth in your mind and heart: the Five Orders were granted dominion over the relics of the Garden by the Creator. Others may steal them for their selfish purposes, but only we have a divine claim to the relics. That is why you are a claimant; you carry our rightful claim to the enemies of the Creator.

On behalf of the Ecumenical Council, may the Light of the Garden bring you consistent fortune, health, and success.

204167.name: The Eldritch Path
204167.description:
From the introduction:

A very powerful archmage named Conjure infrequently sends invitations to lesser wizards to join him for a "discussion." These discussions usually coincide with the invited wizard's search for some difficult answer, an answer Conjure always seems to know.

The tricky part is that Conjure is a bit of an elitist when it comes to magic, and believes that not every brash young spell-slinger necessarily deserves to wield such power. He believes that if any wizard desires to speak to him, that wizard should first pass a series of dangerous tests, specifically designed to destroy the simple, the foolish, or the unlucky.

204168.name: Clown-o-Winks
204168.description:
This undated game uses a tiddly-wink mechanic, but the one disk propels five small plastic rings instead of smaller disks from a red felt mat.

The directions on the box say to prop the lid behind the base as a backboard, and flip the rings onto a target board inset in the box. The board has a central clown face worth 10 on the nose, 5 on the mouth and 2 on the face, along with four small clowns holding starts, worth 3 or 4 points.

The big points come from successfully ringing one of 12 wooden pegs supplied with the game that are pushed through small holes in the boards. Each peg ringed is worth 25 points.

204169.name: Holy Order of the Eternal
204169.description:
From the introduction:

A Glabrezu named Kh'teesh was brought to this failing temple of Anubis by a power-hungry acolyte named Babel. Recognizing the potential for exploitation, Kh'teesh created the religion of "the Eternal," fabricating a palatable history that would prey on the greed of mortals. The acolyte Babel was elevated to the vaunted position of High Priest, and has met with remarkable success spreading his "word".

User summary:

Distributed as a ZIP archive containing the adventure (DOC Format), an item list (ASCII format), and six image files (primarily maps).

204170.name: Freebie
204170.description:
User Summary

You shoot a ball at a paddle trying to hit whichever wall is green.

204171.name: Façade (1998)
204171.description:
From the introduction:

Two weeks ago, a company of thugs managed to intercept a wagon on its way to a wizard's keep, and to their surprise and delight discovered it chock-full of magic items. Understandably, these bandits showed no restraint in bragging about their good fortune, and soon everyone in the area knew what had occurred. This event disturbed the local governments the most, who had been aware of the mysterious and regular transports to the home of this reclusive wizard, Fasahd the Changer, but were never emboldened enough to ask about them. Now their worst fears had been realized, and they are certain that this wizard was stockpiling magic weapons, with plans to arm the humanoid tribes around his home for conquest.

User summary:

Distributed as a ZIP archive containing the adventure (DOC Format) and four image files (maps).

204172.name: Family Secrets (1998)
204172.description:
From the introduction:

Many years ago, when you were but children growing up in the peaceful countryside north of Waterdeep, you would spend your long summer days playing near the warm banks of the Neverwinter River, laughing and enjoying the company of your friends as you pretended you were powerful adventurers exploring the all the hidden nooks and crannies along the riverside.

During many of those early summers, wealthy children from the noble families of Waterdeep would travel up to Neverwinter to get out of the City of Splendors during the hottest months of the year, to live with the relatives and friends of their affluent parents. Many of these children were spoiled rotten and you and the poorer children of Neverwinter decidedly played far away from them. However, one of these young nobles did find her way into your group of make-believe adventurers, a young girl named Lythis Mhairuun who had long golden hair and a kind heart that matched her smile.

Lythis became a good friend to all of you during those childhood years and it was indeed a pity when all of you became older and she had too many responsibilities in Waterdeep to travel up to Neverwinter every summer. Soon her letter ceased to come and it seemed as if she had drifted out of all your lives, much like many old friends do. You happened to hear about a year ago, from her aunt whom which she stayed with as a child, that Lythis had married a nobleman in Waterdeep and that since her father had passed away sometime before, that the Mhairuun family had been absorbed by the marriage.

This being the only news of your friend in the last five years, all of you were more than surprised to receive a letter from your friend this day, as you sat in your favorite tavern near Lord Nasher's Palace. The letter is addressed to all of you and is stamped with a strange and unknown wax seal.

204173.name: Replica
videogamehonor: 2016 IndieCade Best Impact of the Year Winner
2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Honorable Mention
204173.description:
Replica is an interactive novel game played through a cellphone and social media.

You are given a cellphone of an unknown owner. You must look for evidence of terrorism by hacking into the cellphone owner’s account, under governmental coercion. Then inspecting the cellphone usage history and social media activity records. Try this puzzling new experience in gaming.

The insane experience of peeping into someone’s private life through a cellphone will transform you into the state’s greatest patriot.

Source: The Developer Website.

204174.name: Double Quarterback
204174.description:
This 1949 game is subtitled "The Football Game Used by Coaches to Train Their Squads. The football field inset in the box is marked to individual yards, and has peg holes along the side to mark scores, quarters and downs. Other parts include a cardboard 10 yard marker, a plastic football and three dice.

Although each play requires a roll of the dice, with the total compared against a list of plays to determine net yards gained or lost, the key to the game lies in two sets of cards. The defensive player each play secretly chooses one of five formation cards (6-2-2-1, 6-3-2, 7-1-2-1, 8-3 or 5-3-2-1).

The offensive player then calls one of eight possible plays and turns over the top card from the 80-card play deck. Cross-referencing the play row with the defensive column provides a modifier to the die roll, as well as possible fumbles and interceptions.

204175.description:
Become a Super-Villain in Gotham City! Can you escape the World's Greatest Detective?

The Joker, Catwoman, The Riddler, and Poison Ivy are pulling off elaborate heists to score as much loot as they can carry! Based on the award-winning TV show, Batman: The Animated Series Dice Game' lets you become a Super-Villain in a press-your-luck game for the whole family. Roll the dice and take advantage of each villain's diabolical abilities to scheme your way to victory before getting busted by Batman!
204175.name: Batman: The Animated Series Dice Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 48 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Restaurant Games

204176.name: The Final Exam (1998)
204176.description:
From the introduction:

The party is a group of close friends who are going through their respective adventuring schools at the same time. Through the infinite powers of arbitrary coincidence, they are all graduating at approximately the same time.

The schools work together to arrange the Final Exam for the graduating students. The type of exam varies. Some involve actual missions, some involve intellectual challenges, and some involve artificial situations mundanely created. Then, there are the final exams for those suicidal twerps who decide to be adventurers. For them, something special is created...

User summary:

An introductory adventure for brand new characters.

204177.name: Fire and Ice (1996)
204177.description:
From the introduction:

Long ago, in a time when the world of Faerûn was much younger, men lived in gleaming cities on the shores of great inland seas, and wizards ruled on high, experimenting with magics unknown to men today. This was the time of ancient Netheril, when magical carpets and flying castles filled the skies and men still warred with elf and dwarf alike. The common people of the land were little more than slaves to their magic-using masters, wizards who dabbled in the search for immortality. Over centuries, the wizards of Netheril grew powerful, mighty enough to challenge even the gods of the heavens with the ancient secrets they had discovered. The gods of old looked down on Netheril and the foolish pride of its rulers and chose to curse the land in punishment for the wizards' pride.

User summary:

For characters of 7th - 9th level.

204178.name: Lost and Found (1999)
204178.description:
From the introduction:

The kids, against their father's will snuck out early in the morning and went to an old magic user's lab. Which was an old cave in the hills. The kids went a few yards in and Alex (Patricia's brother) fell through a wall and was gone. Patricia screams and the characters hear...

User summary:

For characters of levels 1st - 3rd

204179.name: Survival of the Funniest
204179.description:
From the introduction:

Jalzannel, "The Joker", a Wild Mage, had a reputation for two things: insanity and brilliance. Capricious and a paradigm of chaotic behavior, rumors abound in some arcane circles that a number of strange magics were developed by "The Joker"- magics that to this day have never been found... It goes without saying that a number of wild mages yearn for this undiscovered information. Sigh. Wizards will be wizards.

User summary:

A light-hearted adventure for 2nd - 4th level characters.

204180.name: Bankers & Brokers: The 3D Board Game
204180.description:
It's a race to the top of the corporate ladder in the fast paced family game! Players must use strategy and their wits to accumulate the most money before they retire. Scheme your way to the Chairmen of the Board and then force your friends to pay your debts. But watch out, they might gang up on you and force you into early retirement! Big money, big risks and backstabbing; it's all in a day's work for big business. WILL YOU SURVIVE?

Based on the poker variant of a similar name, players compete to have the best hand, betting on each round based on their position on the 3D board. Each position limits the players hand size as well as betting minimum, with loss causing the player to incur debt. When a player reaches the chairman position, they can pass debts they incur onto lower ranked players. Highest ranked player at the end of the game, who has not been forced into retirement, wins.

204181.name: GURPS Sorcery: Protection and Warning Spells
204181.description:
Stop Trouble in Its Tracks

The life of an adventurer is one of unexplored places, unexpected monsters, and unforeseen dangers. There's so much to do and so much to see, and you can't do any of that if you're dead. That's why all but the most foolhardy sorcerers need GURPS Sorcery: Protection and Warning Spells.

Expanding on GURPS Thaumatology: Sorcery - a must-own tome to use this volume - Protection and Warning Spells provides an array of defensive magic. It includes:


A total of 38 new spells, inspired by their counterparts from GURPS Magic and GURPS Magic: Death Spells. Learn how to preserve your Freedom, block with your Iron Arm, or conjure an Utter Dome.
Clear descriptions and rules for every spell, to prevent arguments at the gaming table. Know exactly how much damage your Resist Fire or Force Wall can stop, how quickly your Atmosphere Dome can purge gases, and more.
New traits and guidelines to handle edge cases. Learn how internal defenses work, how Sealed can prevent corrosion, and what counts as a "magical creature" for the purpose of Force Dome and Force Wall.
Full GURPS Powers statistics for each spell, enabling tinkerers to reverse-engineer and tweak spells to their hearts' content!


The best defense isn't a good offense, it's GURPS Sorcery: Protection and Warning Spells. Keep your guard up!

- Publisher's description

204182.name: The Orcs of Galazar
204182.description:
From the introduction:

A large band of orcs has been seen roaming the hills for some time. The village has recently become a frequent target of their raids. One week ago The Jewel of Rapan was stolen from its owner, the leader of the elders. The elders will pay 1000 GP for the return of the jewel, and the destruction of this threat.

User summary:

For 3rd level characters.

204184.name: Risk Europe
204184.description:
Description from the publisher:
Control the crowns, control Europe in the Risk Europe game--an exciting game of medieval conquest. The game challenges players to step into the role of a medieval king and rule feudal Europe by building castles, taxing subjects, expanding territories, and engaging in battle. This in-depth game of strategy and conquest offers serious gamers a premium gameplay experience. It features 4 separate armies and 7 unique starting kingdoms, each with its own strengths and abilities, plus Kings Orders cards that play an important role in strategy.

User summary:
The goal of the game is to be the first player to control 7 crowns. Each city under a player's control provides a crown and a mission card deck gives an opportunity to earn more crowns.

While there's some similarities to other versions of Risk, the turns are quite different.

Each player has a deck of orders they can take on their turn. They secretly place two orders face down, and the first place starts by revealing an order.

One order card type is to either tax a player's connected territories to gain income or to spend that income on siege weapons, archers, cavalry, infantry units, castles or crown cards.

The other order card type is to expand a player's units into another territory or move units from one territory they own into another.

There are also additional bonuses on some of the order cards.

Battles for contested territories are fought with dice. Non-infantry units are rolled for first by type and deal immediate damage after which all units roll with 3 dice for the attacker and 2 for the defender.

Diplomacy, alliances, and backstabbing are inevitable.

204185.name: Notakto
204185.description:
Introduction

Notakto is a misere 3-in-a-row game for two players. It's played on the squares of a finite number of initially empty 3x3 boards. All pieces are exactly the same and are shared by both players.


Definitions

A board is dead if it contains at least one set of three stones in a straight orthogonal or diagonal line.

A board that is not dead is alive.


Play

On their turn, a player must place a piece on an empty square of a living board.

When all boards are dead, the player who made the last placement loses.

204186.name: Otooreverse
boardgamepublisher: Alhara Systems (アルハラシステムズ)
204186.description:
User summary
オトーリバース (OTOOREVERSE) is a card game with a theme of drinking race. In a drinking party in Japan, 'reverse' means "to reverse what you have ingested". It is a mild expression of 'vomit'.

At the beginning of the game, you are assigned a character, who has their own alcohol capacity and beverage preferences. Their favorite beverage's alcohol counts zero, and hated one counts double toward their capacity.

Each turn, you may choose to quaff a beverage (draw a card), and if the total amount of alcohol exceeds your character's capacity, the character 'reverses' and you are out of the round with no victory points. You should stop drinking before your character 'reverses'.

When any character would quaff a beverage (after drawing a card but before resolving it), you may make an 'alhara' (alcohol harassment) to force any character (including yours) to quaff that beverage. You have limited times of 'alhara' attempts.

At the end of round, each non-'reversed' player gains victory points according to beverages their character has quaffed. After several rounds, the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
オトーリバースとは、より多く酒をのんだ人が勝者というゲームです。
ただし酒のアルコール度数が肝臓の強さを超えると「リバース」してしまいます。
厄介なのは、吐いてしまった人間は悪酔いして他人に迷惑をかけること。
あなたはこの最悪の宴で生き残ることができるのか…

204187.name: Minions Card Game
204187.description:
Join The Minions on their greatest adventure so far! Travelling through the greatest eras in history, The Minions serve the ferocious T-Rex, the great Egyptian Pharaoh and the forces of Napoleon in hopes to be their evil master! Through tragedy and triumph, 3 courageous Minions; Kevin, Bob and Stuart step forward and lead The Minion tribe to their new Evil Master!

Similar to the game of War, each player has a hand of cards containing characters or events, each with a various set of stats. The players take turns calling out a stat from card and then revealing cards, with the card with the highest stated stat winning.

204189.name: Dodgy Dealers
204189.description:
Dodgy Dealers is a collection/deception card game where 2-4 players (up to 12 players with expansions) race to complete their collection and cash in on their contracts. Throughout the game you source your art exclusively on the black market, which is unfortunately full of forgeries and questionable characters. Be the first to reach four genuine contracted artworks to win the game.
​​
Forgeries, Fakes and Fakers! - Work your way through the game by determining which artworks are genuine and which are forgeries. Fake paintings aren't worth anything, but keeping them in your gallery might make opponents think they're authentic!

Multiple paths to victory - Stage heists and steal paintings from opposing players or work through the Black Market to be the first Dodgy Dealer to fulfil their contract.

Completely open trading system - Trades can be struck between any players on a one-for-one basis. Trade face up or face down, be honest or be deceitful, even trade contracts and completely mix up gameplay!

Be secretive - Players must leave their gallery of paintings facedown on the table and may only rearrange them during their own turn.

Be cunning - The pick up and discard systems allow players to develop complex strategies; like removing opponents desired cards out of the game or discarding one of your own contracted paintings temporarily for safety.

Designed with REAL artworks. Dodgy Dealers features paintings of Van Gogh, Claude Monet, Edvard Munch and John Singer Sargent. Eight more artists are available through add-on packs. These include Winslow Homer, James Whistler, Leonardo Da Vinci, Caravaggio, Johannes Vermeer, Rembrandt, William Turner and Eugene Delacroix.

Change the art or invite more to the party - These add-on packs add additional artists of various styles and nationality into the game as well as increasing the game size by two players. Every game comes with enough cards for a four player game but is compatible with up to twelve.

204190.name: We're Off to Kill the Goblins...
204190.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is based in a town called Benden, which is directly off a major trade route and is a major support to the trade route. There is a Merchants Guild in the city that is responsible for holding funds for passing merchants, finding good guards for merchants, and providing safe places for merchants to store their goods. The town has just over 2,000 permanent residence with sometimes twice that amount passing through and saying each week. Benden was raided twice by ten goblins in the past month, the first time about four weeks ago and the second a little over one week ago. Both times the southern most end of town, which is where all of the merchants live, is where the raids where conducted.

User summary:

For 1st - 2nd level characters. Usually distributed with a GIF image (map).

204191.name: Shrine of the Bronze Dagger
204191.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hidden from sight, the Order of the Bronze Dagger worship their foul god in a small shrine cut from a cave. From there they live and work, acting to bring about the fall of civilisation.

A free printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

This map has been released FREE to celebrate our 3rd Birthday!

Contents: A 20 x 20 battlemap depiciting a shrine and living quarters of a cult. The entrance hall is decorated with a large inlaid bronze dagger, and from this room are doors leading to the living quarters of the cultists, and to the main shrine. There is a secret door connecting the shrine to the living quarters.

Also included is a 300dpi full size jpg, for poster printing or VTT. (n.b. gridless version only available as jpeg)

204192.name: Kemonomimi: Moe Races (Pathfinder)
204192.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kemonomimi are humanoid characters that were born from the influence of animal yokai spirits mingling with generations of bloodlines of the families they watched over. After a few centuries these families no longer exhibited their original nature, creating new subspecies of humanoids, known as the Kemonomimi.

There are 7 species that are known to exist: red panda, raccoon, dog, cat, fox, hare, and the tanuki.

204193.name: Ruins of Castle Grimstead
204193.description:
From the introduction:

It is not unusual (even if deeply regretted) that some of the residents of Shadowdale occasionally go missing. Bears, mountain lions and even wyverns are known to occupy the woods around the dale. In recent months however the rate of disappearances has risen. It began with the occasional mysterious loss of caravans on both the Northride and the Tethymar Trail. These losses were clearly not the work of bandits as no bodies were recovered. Then people from the outlying crofts of Shadowdale began to vanish. Travellers brought reports of similar events around Daggerdale. Finally, last tenday, three residents of the village of Shadowdale itself disappeared: Britaria Bestil, Brennan Elventree and Pelda Hillstar.

There are no clues as to where they have gone. Rumours in the Old Skull Inn are rife. Kidnapped by a Red Wizard of Thay say some, slain by agents of Zhentil Keep say others. Whatever the reason it is up to you to find out what the cause of these disappearances may be, and if possible destroy it.

User summary:

For 1st - 2nd level characters. Distributed as a ZIP archive with the DOC adventure and two GIF images (maps).

rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
204194.name: Nowhere City Nights
204194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Nowhere!

In Nowhere City, power-mad Sorcerers battle the righteous Gutter Knights for the final fate of Humanity, while selfish Free Agents seek to profit from the conflict. The End Times are near! The only question is which of the dark Patrons of Chaos will finally conquer what's left of the Earth... and which side will YOU be on?

Nowhere City Nights is a 21st Century urban RPG setting for use with Dungeon Crawl Classics Roleplaying game!

Nowhere City had a better name once, but no one calls it that any more. It's part of a bigger nation, or it once was, but those old power structures are mostly forgotten. Local corporate overlords rule the day and violent gangsters rule the night. The police are an army that serves both of those masters, depending on the neighborhood and the night and the sack of cash. The working people of Nowhere City pray that they can live their lives in peace and anonymity, without attracting the attention of the city's masters' or worse. Behind the bald-faced municipal graft and the corporate corruption, even worse things lurk. Factions battle each other in the never-ending underground occult war that some call "The Shadow Conflict.” Sorcerer cults have turned their back on what’s left of civilization in order to serve the extra-dimensional Veiled Ones. Cadres of Gutter Knights are dedicated to exterminating those cultists at any cost. And the slick, unscrupulous Free Agents will go anywhere, kill anyone, take anything... for a price.

Adventures in Nowhere City might involve:

The Gutter Knights destroying a coven of Sorcerers.
Free Agents stealing an arcane relic from a corporate headquarters.
The power-mad Sorcerers stealing spells from rival cults.




What is Nowhere City Nights?
Nowhere City Nights is a roleplaying game based on the core rules in the Dungeon Crawl Classics Roleplaying Game. (DCC RPG). In Nowhere City, the players take the roles of Gutter Knights, Free Agents or Sorcerers as they scheme and plot and kill in the dim, noir-ish underground of a decadent and declining modern city.

This book contains:

Three DCC classes customized for Nowhere City
Three new sorcerous patrons
Nowhere City setting information
Urban adventure plot hooks
Modern weapons
Vehicle chase rules
And a short bestiary of new monsters for DCC RPG!

204196.name: The Kraggenkrest Castle
204196.description:
From the introduction:

It is nearing dusk, and you are tired from traveling the dusty road. Ahead of you, at the intersection of the Traders Road and the road that leads through the swamp of Shadowmoor, you see the welcome sight of a traveler's inn. The inn is a solidly built two-story building. Hanging over the doorway of the inn is a shingle with the painting of a silver crown. Beside the inn is a large corral. Behind the inn is a small log house, a smoke house, an outhouse, and a large barn. Attached to the barn is a chicken coop. A fenced in mud pit has a large sow and four piglets. Thirty feet behind the inn, on the banks of the marsh river, is a boat house.

User summary:

For 9th - 12th level characters. Usually distributed as a ZIP archive containing a formatted DOC version and seven image files (including six maps).

204197.name: The Laughing Magician: Part 1
204197.description:
From the introduction:

Paadshaw village had been settled for centuries, a group of twenty or so homes nestling in a huge crater-like hollow, supplying a focus for the surrounding farming community. Little had happened there for years until a mild mannered man arrived and announced his intention to buy the recently vacated, and very expensive, manor house. The house had stood empty since the previous rather highly strung occupier fled complaining that the grounds were infested with ghosts. When the newcomer was told this he replied that this was exactly why he wanted it.

User summary:

For a party of abt. 5th level characters, including a few spellcasters. Usually distributed as a ZIP archive including the DOC adventure file and four image files (maps).

204198.name: Kobold Tea Party
204198.description:
Kobold Tea Part: Part 1

From the introduction:

A self-important merchant purchases a unique crystal from an
adventurer to add to his manor's art collection. A week later, Kobolds tunnel into his wine cellar and take control of his manor! Little does the merchant know, but the crystal he purchased summoned something sinister that has been forcing the Kobolds to flee. Kobold Tea Party is the first part of a 6-part adventure series designed to take characters from 1st through 4th level.

User summary:

For 1st level characters. The title is given as The Crystal of Jubilex [sic]

204199.name: Star Drifter
204199.description:
User Summary

It looks and has the wonky controls like a 1970s/1980s arcade machine, but this recently made game is too long lasting to be from that era. You go through space shooting enemy targets, evading enemy targets, and picking up loot from enemy targets.

204200.name: Law vs. Chaos
204200.description:
From the introduction:

The last age of this world ended in a great battle between Law and Chaos. This battle resulted in an land of Law, "floating" in the mists of Chaos. This land's integrity is preserved only by the age-long dedication of one of the lawful lords, Lord Habeas. Lord Habeas was assisted by the sword of power, Juris Est. This sword contains the greatest powers of the other Lords of law, and enabled Lord Habeas to resist the encroachment of Chaos.

User summary:

A unique dungeon for one or two competing parties of adventurers, levels 5 to 12.

204201.description:
When the kids are away, the toys come out to play...AND FIGHT! Welcome to Windup War! Turn the keys and spring into battle! Assemble your army of toys, then command them in combat to be the last army standing! Ready? WINDUP THE WAR!

In Windup War, you plan your army’s course of action to take down the armies surrounding you! Program your units’ actions and strategically snipe your targets! Be the last toy army standing to win!

Windup War features adorably toyetic graphics in a miniature and portable pack! Each faction is a cute size and is ready to fight wherever you go. With six different units per faction, each with unique weapons, there are dozens of configurations for your army; try different combinations to find your favorite strategy! Windup War is easy to pick up and quick to play, with a playtime of about 15-30 minutes.
204201.name: Windup War
boardgamepodcastepisode: #32: Interview w/designers Jessica Chu & Katie Khau (Windup War preview); Puerto Rico on tap; SeaFall first impressions
34 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Dennis Hoyle from Bellwether Games
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 031 – All About Airecon

204202.name: The Tower of Lizards
204202.description:
From the introduction:

About eighteen years ago, a young street witch named Cariole succeeded in catching the eye of the powerful Magus Lord Adrian "Lightcaller," a mage specializing in the use of light-based spells. Other mages tried to warn Lightcaller away from the girl, who was already known in the Order as a bad seed, but he was deaf to their warnings and their romance lasted a tumultuous year and half, until Adrian was killed in a back street down in the Chifes, where he sometimes did missionary work. Rumor has it that Cariole had spiked his drink with Morhiet root, or "Wizardsbane" - which makes a mage incapable of tapping into the akasic patterns to use magic. However, she did retreat in mourning, only to reappear a year later and enjoy her rather large inheritance.

User summary:

For characters of 3rd - 5th level and good alignment. Party should possess magical weapons.

204203.name: Molcrum and the Mage
204203.description:
From the introduction:

Many years ago, in the duchy of Gersot, a wizard was exiled by the duke for what were documented as "blatant acts of cruelty and evil". Exactly what these acts were was not recorded although the peasants who farmed the Duke's lands believed it involved demon worship. Filantis, the wizard, swore an oath that he would return one day to take out his vengeance on the Gersot family for the shame inflicted upon him. More than 150 years have passed since that time and the story of Filantis has passed into local legend. There are even some who question the truth of the story, at least that is, until now.

User summary:

For characters of 6th - 10th level. Usually distributed as a ZIP archive containing the adventure and two image files (maps).

204204.name: Refunct
204204.description:
User Summary

A short first-person puzzle puzzle/platform game. Raise the land from the sea until you've completed the world.

204205.name: No Rest for the Dead
204205.description:
From the introduction:

A village fairly distant from the rest of civilized humanity: population 300. The village is fairly newly formed and colonized, and in the middle of fairly hostile and untamed country. Three-hundred years previous, there was a feudal town on the site, but it was destroyed. Only the foundations of the original buildings remain, including a fairly shredded castle.
...
The village is under attack by a group of evil clerics...

User summary:

A difficult adventure for 1st - 2nd level characters.

204207.name: Quest: The Beginning
204207.description:
From the introduction:

A world shaking event is now drawing nigh. After centuries, the prophesied awakening Elder god, Ashen Sudar, is but years away. Ashen Sudar has been partially awake for several decades, but now is coming fully into his own. His power will be felt on the Prime Material Plane, and the other gods tremble at his approach.

Several brave individuals have been chosen by Fate to keep this from happening. They are the Elected, specially picked by the gods to save Tryll, and protect the world from the ravages of Ashen Sudar.

User summary:

The scenario consists of three distinct parts:


Quest: The Beginning (1st level characters)
Slow Death (1st - 2nd level characters)
Temple of an Elder God (4th - 5th level characters)


The three-part scenario usually is distributed as a ZIP archive including the DOC adventure and nine JPG files (maps).

204208.name: Rake's Hold
204208.description:
From the introduction:

The year is DR (Dominarch's Reckoning) 777, and the Dominarchy is in chaos. Land-dwellers war with the sea-dwelling sahuagin. Monstrous wyrm are attacking farms and mines from their home in the bottomless rift that tore the Dominions in half thirty years ago. Famine and shortages weaken the land, and civil war threatens to tear it apart. Worst of all, a frightening, incurable new disease runs rampant through the Dominions, a magical sickness known as The Hierodule Plague, which twists flesh and mind to create monsters out of normal beings.

User summary:

For characters 7th - 9th level. This adventure adapts some concepts from the Warhammer Realm of Chaos and is presented with a "splatterpunk" feel. The adventure map is not provided but is referenced as the "House of Cards" map from Dungeon (Issue 19 - Sep 1989).

204209.name: The Test of Randor the Great
204209.description:
From the introduction:

Long ago, a great king grew tired of poor performance from his knights and warriors. Feeling that there should be a way to test the worthiness of his knights and men at arms. The king designed, in conjunction with a nearby powerful mage, built a great underground complex that would test those who wished to become one of his knights. The test was originally non deadly and focused on the candidates ability to think and to defend him or herself from a variety of attackers. During the height of the kingdom, many candidates under went the "Test of King Randor". Those who passed the great test became knights in service of the king. Those who failed where sent home until such a time that the king felt they desired another "Test".

User summary:

For 7th - 9th level characters. Distributed as a scenario file and a separate image file (map).

204210.name: What's the Reason?
204210.description:
From the introduction:

You were born to rule. Among the heirs to the most powerful nobles of the land, you have always known that one day, it would be necessary for you to accept the power, the privilege and the responsibility of rulership.

You never thought it would come so young. But His Majesty has commanded, and you are bound by honour, by tradition, and by duty to obey Him. And so you leave your homes, your families, everything you have ever known and loved, to travel to the Royal Court. There you will be trained in the arts of rulership, and the duties that are demanded in return for the privileges that your rank allows you to enjoy. For though you were born to rule, you still have much to learn. You must learn the arts and the arts of war as well, the disposition of troops and the deportment of oneself. You will learn, above all things, that to rule others, one must first rule oneself.

And your life will change forever.

204212.name: The Tower of Refuge
204212.description:
From the introduction:

About 200 years ago a large fire swept through the town of Narborel. The fire started in the Wizard's Guild, killed a number of towns folk and destroyed almost a quarter of the towns timber buildings before it was put out. For this reason the Town Council told the Wizard's Guild to leave and set up their guild house on the large island in Narborel Bay on the condition that they set up a light at the top of the tower to warn shipping of the rocks in the bay. The wizards felt they were unjustly and harshly treated so they named their new guild headquarters "The Tower Of Refuge". The then leader of the Guild, Lazilan, build the tower, walls and guest house using magic and stone brought in from the quarries around Mt. Barule.

User summary:

For low-to-mid level characters. Usually distributed as a ZIP file containing the DOC adventure and two GIF files (maps).

204213.name: Resurrection (1996)
204213.description:
From the introduction:

The players hear from a legend that tells the tale of an ancient castle. The lord of this castle vowed he would defend the realm of any danger coming from the south (and in exchange married the beautiful princess, of course), but when danger came in form of an ancient red dragon sweeping to the north over his castle, he and his knights failed to stop him, thus breaking his vow. So they still roam the castle as spirits, void of voice, till they fulfill the vow. It is said that upon the right constellation of stars, the castle reappears and they have a chance to right their failure. Unfortunately, the dragon did not return, so still the castle reappears and the knights wait.

User summary:

A system-neutral high fantasy adventure. Characters should be of medium power.

204215.name: Revenge of Doppelgänger Band
204215.description:
From the introduction:

Revenge of Doppelgänger Band is an adventure set in the Shadowdale region. It is almost a pure role-playing adventure, so if you wanted a dungeon-type of game, this adventure is not for you. There is only one encounter which ends in combat. Everything else is based on player-NPC interaction, role-playing, and investigation.

204216.name: Ruined Temple Campaign
204216.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs are returning home when they are ambushed by seven bugbears. Overpowered, the are driven into the desert by the bugbears, who, having a religious superstition about that desert, will not follow, but will wait for the PCs for about a week or so. The PCs should go ahead and try to make their way through the desert; call it a little detour.

User summary:

An adventure for low-level characters. At least one character should be a Priest. The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive containing the text scenario and two BMP images (maps).

204217.name: Shoon's Legacy
204217.description:
From the introduction:

Long ago, the Mage-King of Iltkazar, the Lord-most-mighty Shoon, created a grimoire of his greatest magics. An evil and twisted man, Shoon slew a dozen unicorns and used their blood to magically bind his soul to this workbook. Upon the magical text he spun numerous other enchantments, including one which hides its words from sight and another which imprisons careless readers. Shoon finally died and his soul came to rest in the grimoire; a large unremarkable spell book with blank pages that had earned the name, the "Tome of the Unicorn". Shoon continued to exist within the book's back cover as a demilich, a rare but powerful undead spirit which is unturnable and practically invincible. The book passed between the hands of many a wizard in the days after Shoon's death, many of these dying as soon as Shoon's new form drained their souls unexpectedly.

User summary:

For 7th - 10th level characters, including at least one paladin and one mage.

204218.name: Doodler
204218.description:
Create, Play, Share! Doodler is a puzzle platformer with a powerful map editor and workshop support that allows you to create levels to share with the world!

Source: The Developer Website.

204219.name: Bend Sinister
204219.description:
From the introduction:

The kingdom of the Sun has a strict, class-based society. Status and position are very important. The Kingdom has been ruled by Ular IV for forty peaceful years, but is now facing a crisis of succession. The king has three children - the eldest his heir, has been carefully groomed to become King Elen III upon Ular’s death. The second, his only daughter, as was the custom has been trained in priestly duties and was set to become head of the church on her thirtieth birthday. The youngest has been trained in the magical arts, and has been head of the collage of magic for the last three years. All these positions are normally held by the King’s three eldest children. A week before the adventure begins, the King and all three children are wiped out in a freak sailing accident on a lake at the royal Summer retreat. Foul play is not suspected. Normally, in this case, the fourth in line to the throne (in this case, the king’s eldest nephew) would be instated as heir and the queen would rule until her death. However, the queen is ill, and close to death. As soon as news of the tragedy reaches her, she summons the Lord Chamberlain to her bedside and tells him disturbing news. She says that some years before, after the birth of their first child, Ular had revealed to her that he had been unfaithful, and had fathered a son by another woman some years before. The queen was shocked, and refused to hear more, despite the king’s willingness to confess. He managed to blurt out some details despite the queen’s protestations. The matter never arose again between them. However, now it becomes important, since a bastard child would be next in line to the throne before the nephew. It is vital that this son, now probably in his early thirties be found or else war may ensue. The queen remembers few details about the nature of the affair since it was so long ago and so very repugnant to her that she pushed it from her memory.

User summary:

Adventure was designed for tournament play at Gaelcon '94.

204220.name: WITCH-BOT MEGLILO
204220.description:
User Summary

Stop time and project yourself through space with “Time-stop warp” magic.

204221.name: Ghost Sweeper
204221.description:
Ghost Sweeper features fun stylized cartoon graphics and game-play that mixes action and puzzles, with a variety of items to help you along the way. Use your agility and speed to tackle your enemy or plan the perfect strategy to avoid confrontation, it is up to you!

Source: The Publisher Website.

204222.name: Bird of Light
204222.description:
Bird of Light is an action-strategy platformer with a twist. Place bridge tiles to create paths through levels in the sky, then run through avoiding obstacles in your path. Leap over vast chasms, collect loot, and discover new lands on your journey.

Source: The Developer Website.

204223.name: Thieves Guild
204223.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is created for a 1st level party composed of 3-6 characters. It takes place in Shadowdale after the Times of Troubles. The main goal is to eliminate the growing influence of the thieves guild in the region. All information about the Shadowdale region which are required but not mentioned in this module can be found in Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting.

204224.name: Adventure Apes and the Mayan Mystery
204224.description:
https://www.facebook.com/AdventureApes/

Go Ape-bit with this fast-paced retro platformer, in which you work to recover a stolen magical artifact in the labyrinth of an ancient temple!

204225.name: Domain Defense
204225.description:
Domain Defense focuses on what makes Tower Defense Great! Unique towers, distinct enemies.

Source: The Developer Website.

204226.name: Vaspar
204226.description:
From the introduction:
