Weary from travel and miserable from a cold downpour, you and your companions come across a little village set in a clearing in the forest. Surrounded by wet fields, are the grey outlines of buildings. A warm glow comes from the largest building in the town.

You make your way through the sodden streets up to the stone porch of a country inn. A creaky wooden sign over your heads reads The Vaspar Inn: Haven for lost souls. Shrugging off your wet overcoats, you enter the building. The warmth of the room pleasantly warms your cold bodies. The innkeeper, a plump, short man wearing a simple apron, produces a warm mug of ale for each of you. You notice that you are the only people in the inn proper.

204227.name: Exzeal
204227.description:
User Summary

EXZEAL is the followup to TRIZEAL Remix.

204228.name: Lion Quest
204228.description:
Take Jethro the Lion on a magical journey, traversing space and time to prevent the imminent collapse of the universe. Oh and your friend Ronald the Bear is missing, maybe you can find him whilst you’re out exploring?

Source: The Game Website.

204229.name: Rocket Ski Racing
204229.description:
User Summary

Hold the line as your booster rocket pushes you to increasingly insane speeds after every lap in this high speed, unforgiving, 3rd person racer.

204230.name: Winter-Beast
204230.description:
From the introduction:

Pendor is the northern-most town in the kingdom of Elb. It lies very near a particularly dangerous part of the Northern Mountains, however, it is protected by the Pendor River. The river is shallow, but swift and wide. No bridges cross it. The river keeps creatures from the mountains away from Pendor. In the Winter, the river freezes solid, allowing wild creatures from the mountains to cross into town. Many people retreat to the south for the summer, and hire brave, adventurer types to guard their property.

204231.name: WARZONE (2016)
204231.description:
User Summary

The main idea is that all players enjoy their time without having any weapon at the start of the game ... , but everything will change once you hear the alarm.

204232.name: Bot Vice
204232.description:
Show off your skills & reflexes in this frantic single screen gallery shooter, inspired by titles like Time Crisis and Wild Guns. You play as Erin Saver, carrying out her personal vendetta against the criminal Wildbots. Fast arcade action. Pure gameplay. No filler.

Source: The Developer Website.

204233.name: Tomato Jones
204233.description:
https://www.facebook.com/TomatoJonesGame/

It is just a red tomato with a stupid hat. He tries to look like a cool tomb rider, rolling and jumping all over the maps. Help him find all the treasures in the mystic castle or watch him die...in many painful ways.

204234.name: Tumblestone
204234.description:
Tumblestone is the first original action-puzzle game of the past fifteen years -- completely reinventing the genre into a deep and cerebral puzzle solving experience that you won't forget.

Source: The Game Website.

204235.name: 90 Minute Fever
204235.description:
90 Minute Fever is an accessible yet deep football management MMO with no pay-to-win elements. Create and customise your own club, sign real players, compete against a community of highly active managers in a persistent online world and gradually build your own legacy!

Source: The Game Website.

204236.name: Hiiro
204236.description:
Hiiro is a 2D platform game focused on ambient exploration and puzzle solving. Discover a grand world filled with mysterious artifacts and forgotten ruins. Become immersed in relaxing gameplay and meditative music. Remain observant as you unravel an explanation for your solitude.

Source: The Game Website.

204237.name: Ghostbusters (2016)
204237.description:
Grab your Proton Pack and join the Ghostbusters alongside your friends, exploring Manhattan, blasting ghosts, and trapping those runaway ghouls.

Source: The Publisher Website.

204238.name: Survive The Horde Party Game
204238.description:
Survive The Horde Party Game is a 2-8 player character-driven game with zombie battles and in-game challenges intended for a 17+ audience.

The game starts by selecting a character card and a set number of brain chips. Players take turns in a clockwise order. To take a turn, a player takes the top card from the zombie deck and reads it out loud. Zombie cards may have an in-game challenge, a Curse, or you may have to attack the zombie with a roll of the dice. When a zombie is defeated, players are rewarded with a survivor card. These survivor cards feature wacky ways to slay zombies, help you survive, and sabotage other players. When a player fails to defeat a zombie or complete a challenge, they must turn one of their brain chips to its undead side. If all brains have been turned to their undead side, a player is now undead and must try to win battles and challenges to get themselves back in the game.

A player wins by being the last player with at least one healthy brain chip.

204240.name: BoneBone
204240.description:
User Summary

Shoot skeletons that attack your farm before they can tear down your fence.

204241.name: Red X: Facility 342
204241.description:
Red X: Facility 342 is a hidden role playing game where team loyalty is constantly changing.

Players are either part of an alien race that reproduces by taking over the mind and body of a living host, or part of the research team that is attempting to assemble a purification device that will cure the infected players, ultimately saving the entire human race.

Red X: Facility 342 requires multiple playing areas that allow players to go on missions in order to collect parts, but BEWARE, when left alone with an alien you are in danger of being infected yourself. Two players start off already infected. The rest of the players are human researchers, by the second round you don't know who you can trust anymore.

Roles are assigned by passing out DNA Verification Cards at the start of the game. Players choose a Head Researcher and then get sent on a mission with one other player. Mission Rooms are isolated areas located in other parts of the house. Decided by a dice roll researchers may be infected by the alien they were unknowingly paired up with or the researchers could possibly return with a part to the machine needed to kill off the aliens. The aliens win if they can infect the entire research team; the researchers win if they can collect all the parts needed to build the purification device. Either way this exciting hidden role playing game will keep you guessing the entire time.
________________________________________________________________________

"There's a lot of social deduction games out there. What makes yours different? What makes your game special? Why do you enjoy it?" - Aaron

Great question Aaron,
What makes Facility 342 different from what is out there?
I created my game for a couple reasons.

First was because of the number of players current social deduction games can have. We found ourselves with 10-15 players (5-7 couple) quite often. The Resistance cannot be played with that many people. We could play Werewolf but I do not like how you eliminate players.

Second I wanted to add a new element to the social deduction game. Players loyalty can change during game play in Facility 342. What better scenario than body snatchers.

Lastly I wanted a social deduction game that had a role playing feel to it. In my game you have to physically leave the game table to go on a mission with another player. This allows things to happen in private that can affect the whole game. This also allows players to talk in private about their plans and they can use this time to figure out what is going on, or trick players without the interruptions of other players.

204242.description:
Description from the publisher:

New York 1901: Goons of New York is a promotional expansion pack for New York 1901 that adds five new "Boss" cards that give special powers to the players who control each district on the game board.

Once all players in the game have reached the Silver Age, you look to see who controls the most territory of each color on the game board (with pink being excluded in two-player games).

Whoever controls the most of a color takes control of that boss, and at the start of each of your subsequent turns, you can use the "goon power" of one of your bosses to place a goon in a particular location, such as on a street or on a specific Bronze Age skyscraper. You'll score points for this goon based on certain conditions, but if someone ever controls more territory of this color than you, that player takes control of the boss and you have to say goodbye to those goons.

Goons of New York was made in conjunction with the Brooklyn Game Lab, an afterschool program in which children learn to play today's best board games, then discuss the strategies and tactics used to play them. For this project, hundreds of children worked together — in a month-long game-jam — to design and playtest this promotional content for New York 1901, which is currently planned to be made available solely at trade shows and game conventions.
204242.name: New York 1901: Goons of New York

204243.description: Celebrate R&R Games 20th Anniversary with 120 new famous people for Time's Up!
204243.name: Time's Up! Limited Edition Expansion

204246.name: Fran Bow
204246.description:
Fran Bow is a creepy adventure game that tells the story of Fran, a young girl struggling with a mental disorder and an unfair destiny.
After witnessing the gruesome and mysterious loss of her parents, found dismembered at their home, Fran rushes into the woods, together with her only friend, Mr. Midnight, a black cat that Fran had previously received as a present from her parents.
In the forest, Fran goes into shock over the loss of her parents and when she recovers, she’s at Oswald Asylum, an oppressive mental institution for children, and Mr. Midnight is nowhere to be found.
After having a dream about her beloved cat, Fran decides to escape from the mental institution to find him and go back home to Aunt Grace, her only living relative.
Features
Story driven creepy psychological horror adventure game.
Unique and peculiar hand drawn 2D Art-Style and 2D animation.
Self administer medication to open the terrible hidden world that will help solve puzzles and find objects.
A big variety of puzzles designed with different levels of difficulty and specifically based on the story.
Three arcade inspired mini-games all with different art style to be part of the transitions in the story.
Interactive and occasionally playable pet cat, Mr Midnight.
50+ interactive unique characters with unique personalities.
Original Soundtrack.

Source: The Game Website.

204247.name: The Games: Summer Edition
videogameversion: Amiga Go For The Gold edition
C64 / C128 Go For The Gold edition
204247.description:
User Summary
Epyx and US Gold takes us to the 1988 Olympics in Seoul, where we can compete against each other in eight disciplines:
* Velodrome Cycling
* Archery
* Uneven parallel bars
* Rings
* Hammer throw
* Springboard diving
* 400 meter hurdles
* Pole vault

You can practise each discipline before starting the Olympic game.

Re-released in 1992 under the name "Go for the Gold"

Not to be confused with the earlier games Summer Games[/thing] (1984), and Summer Games II (1985)

204248.name: Ghost Battle
204248.description:
User Summary

Your girl have been kidnapped by the undead! Now you have to go rescue her!

204249.name: Giganoid
204249.description:
User Summary

Danish Breakout clone

Design: Lars Bendrup, Jan Nielsen, Søren Grønbech, Mads Rasmussen, Ivan Sølvason
Coder: Lars Bendrup
Graphics: Torben Bakager Larsen, Lars Bendrup
Musician: Pascal De Sapio

204250.name: Grid Start
204250.description:
Box back (black box edition)

Drive your six gear Formula 1 racing car over six world famous circuits like BRANDS HATCH - MONZA, each curve and fend faithfully reproduced. You will need the skills and reactions of a Grand Prix driver to compete against 23 other cars, each with it's own individual characteristic performance.
The six gear formula caar has to be driven with utmost skill. THe acute ends require rapid gear chanes, judicious use of brakes and rapid acceleration as you pull out of the bends. Opportune use of BOOST can get you out of many a tight corner.
You are well advised to practise each course thoroughly and to kean and memorise each bend. There are three categories - Novice, Amateur and Professional, each with its own championshop tables.
Thee road to the Professional Championship is long and arduous. Practise, skill and courage are the essential requirements.

204251.name: Highway Patrol II
videogameversion: Amiga 16-Bit Pocket Power Collection edition (budget release)
204251.description:
Back of the game box

At the wheel of your patrol car you are in pursuit of a band of gangsters. You will first have to spot them, then to head them off. To help you the HQ will indicate their position at every moment.
HIGHWAY PATROL is a tough action game, a real 3D driving simulator, that joins all the elements of a thrillng car race.

204252.description:
The Teacher

When using the Teacher, you must use its yellow side during round 1-3, and the red one during round 4. When playing with the Teacher, you will be the first player to choose a character next turn, no matter when you pass this round. Cash limit: $60.

Red side (only available in the last round): During the final scoring, you get 2 victory points for each School, Prison, or Church you own, and you also get 2 victory points if you don’t own any Saloon(s). Cash limit: $60.

Town Hall

Use this tile instead of a generic red house tile to depict the starting location of Carson City at the start of the game.

Note: As these are included in the Big Box of Carson City, this small expansion is meant for owners of the base game.
204252.name: Carson City: The Teacher & Town Hall

204253.name: Hollywood Poker
204253.description:
Back of Robtek game box
Hollywood Poker is a high-class strip-poker with the help og digitalized graphics. Play poker against beautiful girls, one of them a real Miss Germany! When your martner loses money she has to take off her clothes. You can choose between four different girls. Try your luck!

Back of Keypunch game box
Set the stakes, stack the deck to get ready for a poker game that could make you lose your shirt! Bet money and clothing againt the lovely ladies on your computer screen, in the highly stimulation round of five card draw!

Will they entice you to lose all your money or will you ruthlessly take them to the cleaners in this show-all match of skill?

Just who will have the last laugh... and the last stitch of clothing?

Back of Smash 16 game box
Hollywood Poker is a stimulating strip poker simulator that uses actual digitalised photos of four beautiful female contestants who'll bet it all for a chance to strip you down!

Match your wits against Stephanie, does she really have a pair or is she bluffing? You'll have to bet your shirt to find out what she's hiding.

Take it from us, these girls are no push over, each one has her own distinctive style of play, and each is a feast for the eyes.

Also published as Adult Poker (by Keypunch)

204254.name: Hollywood Poker Pro
204254.description:
User Summary
Strip poker game, and sequel to Hollywood Poker (aka Adult Poker).

Back of Top Shots game box
Expectantly you the marble portal. You walk towards the bar and study the various people. Your eyes stop at once at one particular table as they suddenly behold the most beautiful woman you have ever seen. She is sitting alone. Slowly you make your wat towards her... The shrill ring of your alarm clock abrubtly wakes from yur dreams. But this dream can now come true with Hollywood Poker Pro.

204256.name: Labyrinth (1990)
204256.description:
User Summary
Based on a Danish TV-show with Kim Schumacher, based on INK's game from 1982.

You have to go through a maze with gates; but to open the gates you have to answer questions. Each question have four options. When you get to the centre you get to the final round in the invisible labyrinth!

Made for the Danish Commodore magazine "Det Nye Computer"

204257.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #15 - Jul 2016)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
204257.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue we include DCC RPG content inspired by Kamandi: The Last Boy on Earth, part of Jim Wampler's "Appendix M" for Mutant Crawl Classics. We feature 4 classes, two monsters and a new DCC Patron.

204258.name: Skull and Crossbones: Piracy in Clement Sector
204258.description:
From publisher blurb:

ARRRR! Heave to and prepare to be boarded!

Piracy has been a near constant in Clement Sector since the Conduit was first opened. In fact, some historians maintain that piracy may have played as large a part in the direction that civilization spread from Hub as did the astrography of the sector. The act has been part of the fabric of the sector and continues to be so despite the best efforts of the many planetary governments.

Piracy in Clement Sector includes down on their luck merchant crews forced to compromise their morality, people who watched one too many episodes of Superpirate! and think they can do that too, ex-military people who are working for one government to disrupt the trade of another, dedicated pirates who are just stone cold killers, and marauders who are attacking new colonies along the frontier.

Skull and Crossbones: Piracy in Clement Sector covers all of these and delves into the tactics, lives, and traditions of the sector's pirates. The book covers the pirate havens, the articles of agreement, and the pirate code (more of a guideline, really). Each subsector's piracy problems are covered in detail to let merchants know where to avoid and pirates know where is safe to strike!

In addition, two unique pirate vessels are detailed here as well. The Demon-class lembus and the Ironbard-class longship. Both are presented in our usual Ships of Clement Sector format with in-depth descriptions, full deckplans, and beautiful art.

Grab your cutlass! Get your rum! It's time to go pirate, me mateys!

204259.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume XXII
204259.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume XXII, and its predecessors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 22 mythic spells, from undetectable alignment to zone of truth. A mythic virtue spell lasts for a full hour, and grants one of seven additional benefits, each based on a different virtue. A mythic wail of the banshee gives greater control over which creatures are affected, and can cause those it slays to rise as banshees on the following round, while a mythic weird forces creatures to save a second time on the following round in order to survive, and can permanently haunt the nightmares of creatures that die and are resurrected, and a mythic wind wall blocks creatures from being able to pass through it without making Strength or Fly checks. This tome contains all that, and much, much more!

204260.name: Side Paths: Silver Rebels - Kennels of the Red Fang
204260.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s a Dog Eat Dog World!

Adventure paths offer fantastic stories and sweeping campaign arcs that take characters on a ride from very low levels all the way up to the highest reaches of the game, and they can be incredibly fun and rewarding to play. But even though there’s a lot packed into an adventure path, sometimes you find yourself wishing for more, whether there’s a part of the adventure path that feels like it got a bit rushed or cut due to space issues, or just a fun little side trek to take a breather before jumping back into the action of the main story. Side Paths provides just this sort of content, with short adventures designed to fit into portions of existing official Paizo adventure paths, but which can easily stand on their own, or be inserted into other, similar campaigns.

In this adventure for a party of 2nd- or 3rd-level characters, designed to occur during or after the first volume (#97) of the rebellious adventure path from Paizo, Inc, the party is approached by a man with a seemingly simple request: his dog has been kidnapped by the owner of the Red Fang, a dog-fighting ring with a nasty reputation. With dog-fighting quite legal in the area, and the authorities unable (or unwilling) to find any evidence of the missing dog, hiring rebellious heroes willing to work outside the law to do good deeds is this man’s last hope. But as the PCs delve into the kennels of the Red Fang, it quickly becomes apparent that there’s a lot more going on here than a missing dog. Can they defeat the strange and twisted monsters caged in those kennels?

204261.name: The Ghost Next Door
204261.description:
From publisher blurb:

A family in the neighborhood has been trying to sell their house without success. They believe the cause of this is from locals spreading rumors that their house is haunted. But the truth is far more bizarre! Recent phenomena have caused a number of ley lines running under this very property to activate, which has powered an old, forgotten mirror that has now become an uncontrollable gateway to the netherworld!

204262.name: Arachniman
204262.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of many children kidnapped and experimented upon by the evil genius, DR. CHRYSALIS, young Ben Barrow grew up to discover that his genetics had been altered, endowing him with the speed, strength, and agility of a spider! Frightened and nervous at first, he spent much of his free time in his teen years learning how to use his abilities so that he could live up to the example set by the heroes who once saved him from the clutches of evil. Now that he's graduated high school, he's built up the courage (and put together a cool costume) to act in the open as the super powered here, ARACHNIMAN!

204263.name: Fallout
204263.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of a group of scientists kidnapped and forced to work on a doomsday machine, he was caught in a terrible accident when so-called heroes attacked the hidden laboratory. Years of pain caused by the radiation damage to his body and mind cost him both his family and his sanity. Driven to get back all he deserved he was owed and to make these "heroes" pay for their carlessness, he uses his vast radiation powers to threaten the city as the super criminal FALLOUT!

204264.name: The Wizard's Dungeon (Pathfinder)
204264.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dungeons, Dragons, and Death Await!

Armed with knowledge of a villainous wizard’s plans, a party of heroes must venture into the dreaded Shadescar Rift, a deep cave that leads into the dark tunnels beneath the earth. Legends say that it was created by the claw of some terrible beast. Locals stay well clear of the rift and claim it is the home of nightmare creatures that prey on the unwary. But only by braving such dangers can the PCs hope to stop their mysterious enemy. If they fail, he will unleash a great and terrible power upon the world.

The Wizard’s Dungeon is an adventure for 5th-level characters. It is the final adventure in the Trail of the Apprentice saga, a full campaign made up of 5 interconnected adventure modules for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game! The Trail of the Apprentice saga and all adventures in the the Legendary Beginnings line from Legendary Games are designed as exciting adventures suitable for all ages, but specially designed for those new to roleplaying and those on the younger side. Download includes a 62-page adventure plus a 14-page art and map folio, including unkeyed player-friendly maps! Grab this awesome adventure today and Make Your Game Legendary!

204265.name: The Wizard's Dungeon (5E)
204265.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dungeons, Dragons, and Death Await!

Armed with knowledge of a villainous wizard’s plans, a party of heroes must venture into the dreaded Shadescar Rift, a deep cave that leads into the dark tunnels beneath the earth. Legends say that it was created by the claw of some terrible beast. Locals stay well clear of the rift and claim it is the home of nightmare creatures that prey on the unwary. But only by braving such dangers can the PCs hope to stop their mysterious enemy. If they fail, he will unleash a great and terrible power upon the world.

The Wizard’s Dungeon is an adventure for 5th-level characters. It is the final adventure in the Trail of the Apprentice saga, a full campaign made up of 5 interconnected adventure modules for the 5th Edition of the world's most famous roleplaying game! The Trail of the Apprentice saga and all adventures in the the Legendary Beginnings line from Legendary Games are designed as exciting adventures suitable for all ages, but specially designed for those new to roleplaying and those on the younger side. Download includes a 62-page adventure plus a 14-page art and map folio, including unkeyed player-friendly maps! Grab this awesome adventure today and Make Your Game Legendary!

204266.name: Horns of the Hunted (5E)
204266.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fabulous fey adventure for 6th-level characters!

Evil stirs in the depths of the Gnarled Forest. The heroes of the land, taming the wilderness and forging their kingdom, hear disturbing tales from woodsmen and trappers of a strange and ferocious hunting party ranging far and wide beneath the forest eaves. It is not only from human tongues that they hear warnings of these dread hunters, for the allies they have found amongst the fey and other woodland creatures are likewise deathly afraid of what these savage raiders may portend. The heroes are called upon by Myvenwy, a unicorn warden of the wood, who begs their aid in facing this peril, one that threatens her and her kind above all, but should the unicorns fall there will be none to stand against the raging Horns of the Hunted!

This adventure is a 5E adventure for 6th level characters that is a great addition to your campaign whenever your heroes are feeling a bit too comfortable and complacent, as the wild world around them rises up in chaos and danger as otherworldly enemies intrude upon the mundane mortal world. Horns of the Hunted can be played alone or as a loosely coupled followup to Cold Mountain, and either adventure or any wilderness 5E campaign that features the fey can be greatly enhanced with products like the character collection of Conquering Heroes, the new creatures and character options and ideas of Faerie Passions, the fabulous fey magic within the Treasury of the Kingdom, or the terrifying monsters of the frozen forest in the Boreal Bestiary and Coldwood Codex! Featuring a desperate pursuit of mysterious fey both malevolent and benign, in Horns of the Hunted superstar author Matt Goodall has created a dreamlike and otherworldly feel that provides a memorable journey into the dangerous and deadly world of the fey, with beautiful maps by Alyssa Faden and delightfully old-school art by Pete Fairfax.

204267.name: Dungeon of Telgus Miner
204267.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Filbar Quest series continues with FQ11 – Dungeon of Telgus Miner. As you continue to pursue the lost pages from the Codex of Gamber Dauch (Daw-sch) you receive a missive from your cleric’s church. With your fame building the Caravan Masters have gone to the church to request your assistance with a strange humanoid uprising in the west. After a bit of research, you discover the area may/may not be home to a magical crozier. The trouble is in a rural area and home to the community of Rantoul. A meager humanoid incursion shouldn’t cause you too much trouble and you decide to accept the mission!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Quest Campaign for a group of mid to upper level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

204268.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Jean Grey
204268.description: A founding member of the X-Men, a mutant with telepathic and telekinetic powers and the love interest of Cyclops and later his wife. She is both a caring and nurturing person, but also has to deal with being one of the most powerful mutants around and is in a constant struggle to control her powers. An Omega-level mutant, that once she could not control it took on the physical manifestation of the cosmic Phoenix Force or Dark Phoenix.

204269.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Sabretooth
204269.description:
Description from the publisher:

Sabretooth (born Victor Creed) is a mutant who, has a number of animal-like abilities, such as retractable claws, enhanced senses, and a regenerative healing factor. Sabretooth is a formidable hand-to-hand combatant, having been trained by the Foreigner, the C.I.A., and many others. Sabretooth is also an extraordinary hunter and tracker.

204270.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Nightcrawler
204270.description:
Description from the publisher:
Nightcrawler possesses superhuman agility, the ability to teleport and can climb walls and other obstacles with ease. He also has indigo / blue coloured skin, which allows him to become nearly invisible in the shadows and he has a prehensile tail. A devout Catholic, Nightcrawler's name is Kurt Wagner and he is from a small village called Witzeldorf in Germany and was part of a circus act until he was recruited in to the X-men. Later in the comics it is found out that Nightcrawler’s parents are Azazel and Mystique.

204271.name: Hyspherical 2
204271.description:
User Summary

Place moving circles on pre-arranged tracks and avoid them colliding with each other.

204272.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops III – Descent
videogameexpansion: Call of Duty: Black Ops III
204272.description:
User Summary

Descent adds four new multiplayer maps, along with a brand new zombies experience. Descent will also continue the Origins Zombie saga with a new chapter, Gorod Krovi, set in an alternate universe 1940s Soviet Union. Players will have to work together to hold back hordes of “mechanized zombie infantry” and “aerial dragon assaults” in the ruins of Stalingrad.

204273.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Extreme VS Force
204273.description:
User Summary

Mobile Suit Gundam Extreme Vs. Force is a portable spin-off of the Extreme Vs series.

204274.name: Lotus Esprit Turbo Challenge
videogameversion: Atari ST GBH Gold edition (budget release)
SEGA Mega Drive edition: EA Classics – Europe (budget release)
ZX Spectrum GBH Gold edition (budget release)
204274.description:
The first game in the series was released in 1990 for most popular contemporary 8-bit and 16-bit computer systems, the Amiga version being the most technically advanced. The game allowed the player to race a Lotus Esprit Turbo SE car through several (32 in the Amiga version) circuit race tracks of varying scenery. Two player simultaneous play (with split screen) was also provided, and a choice of audio tracks to accompany races.

Each track is lap-based and consists of turns of varying degrees, as well as hills and hollows which slow down or speed up the car passing through them. Each turn is indicated by a chain of road-side signs, and the difficulty of the turn is reflected by the number and density of these signs - a feature common to all titles in the Lotus series.

While racing, the players must manage their fuel supply, occasionally visiting the pit stop for refuelling. Also apart from overtaking the other cars, the racers must avoid various hazards and obstacles. These are dependent on the scenery the track is located in, and include slippery road on the winter courses, road blocks, slippery puddles and wooden logs.

The tracks are split into three race series, with different difficulty levels. In each race the player or players compete against 20 opponents. The goal is to finish each race on the highest possible position; if the player finishes a race within the first 10 places they qualify for the next race and receive points towards a final position on the high-score table. The names of the computer-controlled drivers are puns on the names of real-life racers of the time ("Ayrton Sendup", "Nijel Mainsail" and "Alain Phosphate" for example).

Unusually, the player's starting position in each race is the exact opposite of the position reached at the end of the previous one. This gives weaker players a chance to improve by starting in a higher position.

When racing in the one-player mode, the bottom half of the screen is unused and features a static image of the Esprit Turbo. In the two-player mode one half is used by each player. The two-player feature operates similarly to the one-player mode, except that only one player needs to reach 10th place to qualify both players for the next race.

In the Amiga version entering MONSTER and SEVENTEEN as names of players 1 and 2 respectively, reveals a hidden mini-game - a simple space-themed shooter, where the objective is to survive as long as possible while shooting rocks that fly around.

Reception
Lotus Esprit Turbo Challenge was well received by the gaming press, which praised its feeling of speed, technical quality and two-player gameplay. The game in all its versions was rated around 80-90%. It was the only title in the series that was released for an 8-bit platform - the later ones were 16-bit only.

The ZX Spectrum version was voted number 17 in the Your Sinclair Readers' Top 100 Games of All Time.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lotus_%28series%29%23Lotus_Esprit_Turbo_Challenge Lotus (series)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

204275.name: KYUB
204275.description:
Puzzle games are seeing a revival on consoles and Kyub is taking the lead! Move the “Kyub” and use its abilities to solve devious puzzles and escape malicious traps. Switch between action and puzzle phases where you manipulate other cubes to climb walls and destroy obstacles with lasers or activate switches to trigger new paths. Protect yourself and change the Kyub’s status to become immune to the elements. Master the Kyub and discover all its insane possibilities.

Source: The Developer Website.

204276.name: VIDEOBALL
204276.description:
VIDEOBALL is a sport everyone can play. We researched basketball, football, soccer, first-person shooters, and real-time strategy games. VIDEOBALL is a compact expression of all sports' mechanics.

Source: The Game Website.

204277.name: Jackpot 777
204277.description:
Realistic slot machine game with simple controls and endless fun. Bet one credit or go for a big win with the MAX BET! Winning combinations include 7's, Fruit, Bars, & more. Classic Slot Machine action at its best!

Source: [http://www.nintendo.com/games/detail/jackpot-777-wii-u# The Publisher Website].

204278.name: Manchester United Europe
204278.description:
Back of game box
Manchester United Europe takes the world league club into the European arena of club knockout competitions, which includes the European Cup, European Cup Winners Cup, UEFA Cup, European SUper Cup and the World Club Champoinshop held each year in Japan.
Game features! 4 player options (using 4 player joystick adaptor Amiga & Atari ST), full goalkeeper control (Amiga & Atari ST), new control method in-corporating one touch footbal and aftertouch, substitutions (animadted 1 Meg Amiga), players number on shirt (Amiga & Atari ST), name of player on the ball, full screen (Amiga), yellow and red cards, senfing off, action replays (1 Meg Amiga), player statistics in competition, 7 saved game options (Amiga & Atari ST), 170 clob badges of the major european teams (Amiga & Atari ST), penealty shoot outs in cup competitions, arcade only option, management only option or full simulation option.

204279.description:
Description from the publisher:

Baby Blues Continues is an expansion for the card game Baby Blues with different parts that can be used separately or in combination. They are:

1) Cards allowing for play with up to six players.

2) A variant for two players: When you play the original game with two players, there are two adjustments compared to the normal game. First, you can't trade, and second, the points on the back of the cards are irrelevant. With the variant, this won't be the case anymore. Players now can trade cards with a closet and the game can end early because the babies are picked up by their parents, so both players have points to count.

3) A new type of card — the action card: On your turn, you can play the same cards as in the base game, but in addition you can play as many action cards as you want. With these cards you can transfer problems to other babies or trade babies with an opponent, making the game a little bit meaner and also more tactical.

4) A new problem — the sick baby: What will happen with a baby if you give him too much pie at a birthday party? He will become nauseous and this problem will only be solved when he vomits. The owner of the baby can choose the direction and the baby to his left or right will start crying immediately. Luckily there is medicine available, but will you be able to give it to the baby in time?
204279.name: Baby Blues Continues

204280.name: Maria's Xmas Box
204280.description:
Back of box
STRIP POKER never had such a glamourous challenger. MARIA WHITTAKER invites you to take you seat, clean your screen and settle down to pit your wits and skill against her wiles and charm. Do not let her looks and guile fool you into making rash bets or uyu will lose all you stand in before you can say MARIA WHITTAKER.
If you can keep your cool and take you chances boldly; your screen will sizzle as MARIA reveals the stunning charms and beauty that made MARIA a household name and a dream girl of millions across the five continents. The turn of a card can make the dream come true.

Maria Whittaker
Maria Whittaker (born 7 October 1969 in Hounslow, Middlesex) is an English former glamour model, Page 3 girl and singer.

Modelling career
In 1985, Whittaker made her début as a Page 3 girl in British newspaper The Sun at the age of 16.[2] With her brunette hair, good looks and natural 36DD breasts, she became one of the most celebrated glamour models of the 1980s alongside Samantha Fox and Linda Lusardi.

In 1987, Whittaker appeared on the cover of Palace Software's computer game, Barbarian: The Ultimate Warrior, along with Michael Van Wijk (also known as Wolf) from the Gladiators television show.[3] In 1988, they appeared again on the cover of Barbarian II: The Dungeon of Drax.

Whittaker was also the star of Maria Whittaker's X-Mas Strip Poker, a computer game released in 1988 for the Commodore Amiga, Commodore 64 and 128.
Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maria_Whittaker Maria Whittaker]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary
Box and diskette labeled Maria's Christmas Box, whereas the game itself says Maria's Xmas Box in title.

204281.description:
Description from the publisher:

When the lights switched back on, the prized bottle of milk collection was gone. The suspects are a bunch of incognito babies who try to sneak them out of the mansion. Can you expose your opponent's secret identity and hide yours? Retrieve five bottles of milk and win the game.

Baby Clues is a deduction game. Every turn you have to expose a little bit of your identity to plan your escape. Every player receives a secret identity as well as an object they hate. For example, the vampire baby doesn't like garlic, the robot baby doesn't like water, and the dirty baby hates soap. On your turn, you have to pick up objects, but you can never pick the object you hate. Choose your items wisely because every card you collect discloses valuable information about your secret identity.

During the game, you constantly have to try to find the balance between unmasking your opponents and picking up all the objects you need to escape. Both give you the opportunity to score points. If somebody tries to unmask you, but they make a mistake, you also score a bonus point, so a little bit of bluffing can also come in handy.
204281.name: Baby Clues

204282.name: Mystic Miners
204282.description:
High in the Mountains of Daggerstone, There once existed the most amazing city. A great and wealthy city, Lost. Swallowed up by the very mountains that acted as its strongest defense from invasion. Though its name has been lost to the ages, its legend lives on. Some say, deep within the mountain’s caverns, deep within The City’s ruins, The City’s greatest treasure remains. The Allstone. A gemstone so saturated with magical energy, that whomever possesses it can do the impossible. It’s also REALLY shiny.
Now, The best Petramancers in all the land race to find The City and lay claim to The Allstone.

Players draw Ore Cards in order to claim Tool Cards with matching ore types. Claiming Tool Cards earn you Depth Points. First Player to 10 Depth is the winner

204283.description:
The Trump Pack is a pack of 25 cards that is included in the 'Donald Trump Bug-out Bag'. The pack contains 3 black cards, 22 white cards and one double sided 'Comedy Rations' card.

The publisher describes the Donald Trump Bug-Out Bag as:
"A pre-packed duffle bag with over a dozen items hand-picked to help you survive the collapse of civilization after Donald Trump is elected President of the United States. Includes the Cards Against Humanity Trump Pack with 25 new jokes about frightening demagogue Donald Trump."
204283.name: Cards Against Humanity: Trump Pack

204286.name: Big Trouble in Little China: The Game
204286.description:
Description from the publisher:

There is a secret world where ancient evil weaves a modern mystery… they call it Little China. It’s where Big Trouble was waiting for Jack Burton and his friends as they uncover an ancient diabolical plot. The evil minions of the immortal ghost-sorcerer Lo Pan are waiting to chop down the players with axes and guns in dark alleys and all throughout the battle-torn streets of Chinatown. Now, Jack, Wang, Gracie, and the rest of the gang must muster up all of their courage, survive against hordes of baddies, and then face off in a showdown with the darkest demon of them all Lo Pan!

Big Trouble in Little China the Game sends you and up to three other players on a wild adventure to experience the unknown and mystical underworld of Chinatown. Each brave character uses their own unique talents and abilities to take on various missions throughout Little China; working together to gain enough Audacity to take down Lo Pan, the Three Storms, and a slew of other powerful henchmen, in this cooperative, replayable, cinematic experience.

You will venture through the iconic locations in Chinatown saving the helpless and thwarting evil plans, all the while discovering weapons and rare magics to use to your benefit. Player actions are powered by thematic dice that are rolled each round. These dice will be used to take part in combat, testing your luck taking audacious actions, and get players in and out of “Big Trouble." But beware: roll bad luck and suffer the consequences!

The clock’s ticking as Lo Pan inches closer to breaking the curse and regaining his mortal form. The heroes are thrown into a final showdown with Lo Pan and his most elite bodyguards to finally put an end to his reign of terror. You’ll need all of your guts and glory to rescue the green eyed beauty, defeat ancient magic, and save Chinatown... in Big Trouble in Little the Game!

204287.name: Surviving Mars: The First Mission
204287.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the late 21st century, a coalition of wealthy governments, troubled by the continued destruction of earth's natural habitats, put together a team of elite astronauts to begin the first human settlement on Mars. The mission was postponed by the onset of World War IV, and as the war waged, much of what made the earth livable was decimated. Civilization neared the brink of collapse, peace and stability became distant memory, and what resources did remain were quickly becoming unsuitable for sustaining life on earth.

The mission to build a settlement Mars was our last promising hope.

The Astronauts were recommissioned, this time covertly, and given only 10 weeks to prepare for the mission. Rusty from their lapse in training and limited by the global scarcity of resources, this group of elite astronauts remained the last hope for civilized life.

Surviving Mars: The First Mission, is a game about those first few astronauts and how they managed to create the first settlement on Mars almost a century ago.

In this game, players must work together to construct a predesigned and prefabricated habitat consisting of a biosphere, a sustainable crop system and a number research laboratories. Additionally, players must complete a number of critical life supporting research tasks in order to ready the habitation system and the Martian terrain for the first wave of humans.

The game can be played as a single experience, or series of episodes where player continue further the mission, and pick up where the last game left off.

This game is a cooperative (or solo) worker placement, dice rolling and deck building experience, that complement the push-your-luck feel of dice with the ever growing stability of deck building. Player cooperative choose teams of two astronauts (each with their won specialty) to complete missions over a series of episodes. Players take on the role of one of four characters; Biologist, Engineer, Researcher, or Commander. (An expansion is still in development that will allow a 5th character, the Medic.)

Each round players must cooperatively make both tactical and strategic decision with an overwhelming amount of unknowns.

Should we build our agricultural economy by constructing another Biosphere, planting crops, and/or harvest crops? Should we perform maintenance on the HAD and life support system, or? Should we perform research that may be give us key insights and could be critical to allowing us to complete all our other ongoing missions much more efficiently? Should we a rest, heal up, focus on the team morale and make sure our team is not on the brink of Psychosis. And many more.

This is a game that is meant to immerse the players into what it would feel like to be on a mission to settle Mars. The game is based upon the science and articles published by NASA, Space-X, Mars One, The Martian (the Novel by Andy Weir) and many years of personal interests and research into the topic of what it would take to settle and colonize Mars!
A successful Martian settlement means, players must strategically balance a number of risks: the natural risks of the Martian terrain and extreme Martian temperatures; solar radiation and sandstorms; the immediately fatal risks of damage to their life support systems or habitat; and, or course, starvation. All this while still maintaining the state of mental and physical health necessary to construct the full habitat before the next wave of humans arrives!

Can you survive the first mission to Mars?

204288.name: Old Mother Hubbard
204288.description:
This is a Snap-style card game most notable for its fantastic graphics. The best are not Old Mother Hubbard herself or her Cupboard, but the five sets featuring her dog, titled: Dog; Laughing Dog; Dancing Dog; (Dog) Riding the Goat; and (sadly) Dead Dog.

The box is undated, but Alex G. Malloy in American Games: Comprehensive Collector's Guide, dates it to 1910 (p. 36, # 1143).

204289.name: Aesop
204289.description:
This is a late 19th Century card game in which each of the 17 pairs is composed of a card with a recap and moral from one of Aesop's fables, and another with an illustration of that fable. The odd card is a portrait of Aesop himself, and all the artwork is fantastic.

All the cards are dealt out. The player to the left of the dealer takes one card from the player to his right (the dealer in this case) and then lays down in front of him as many pairs as possible. Each player in turn repeats until all pairs have been laid.

The Aesop card may be played at any time, and has the effect of doubling the number of matches beneath it. Winner is the player with the greatest number of matched pairs at the end of the game.

The box is undated, but Alex G. Malloy, American Games: Comprehensive Collector's Guide, dates it to 1890 (p. 34. #1001).

204291.name: Cosmic Cavern 3671
204291.description:
Cosmic Cavern was published in July 1980 by Takaya Arita, currently a professor at Nagoya University. This “Tactical Digging Game,” which existed two years prior to Dig Dug as the original sandbox game, has now been dramatically powered up!

Source: The Developer Website.

204292.name: Daily Chthonicle: Editor's Edition
204292.description:
This game lets you try on the role of a Supernatural Newspaper Agency boss and editor. The world it takes place in is a dark and haunted one, with ghosts, zombies, monsters and even shapeshifting murderers, pretending to be human after they have stolen their victims' bodies or infiltrated the humanity.

Source: The Developer Website.

204293.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Groot
204293.description:
Description from the publisher:
The Guardians of the Galaxy is a group of cosmic adventurers led by Star-Lord to protect the universe from threats all across space. The team also includes Drax, Gamora, Groot and Rocket Raccoon! The team are good guys, though sometime not that good. Groot is an unknown tree like creature that only talks with Rocket Raccoon through 3 words, "I am Groot".

204294.name: Duckie Dash
204294.description:
Duckie Dash is a casual racing game that can be played solo or with up to 4 players split-screen. Race rubber duckies across 30 different levels with features like jet streams, geysers, and more! Easy enough for small children to play, but timed challenges make it fun for adults too!

Source: The Game Website.

204295.description: Two figure pack for Arcadia Quest for heroes Mamba & Rosh
204295.name: Arcadia Quest: Mamba & Rosh

204296.description: Two figure pack for Arcadia Quest for heroes Viola & Crash
204296.name: Arcadia Quest: Viola & Crash

204297.name: Quell Zen
204297.description:
Quell Zen - the very embodiment of relaxing logic games - features over 200 beautifully crafted challenges.

Source: The Developer Website.

204298.description: Two figure pack for Arcadia Quest for heroes Anvil & Valma
204298.name: Arcadia Quest: Anvil & Valma

204299.description: Two figure pack for Arcadia Quest for heroes Yona & Kuruk
204299.name: Arcadia Quest: Yona & Kuruk

204300.name: RoShamBo
204300.description:
Welcome to RoShamBo arena! A brand new FREE arena fighting game, based on a classic rock-paper-scissors! Choose your character out of dozens unique looks, customize your gear, fight other players, knock their teeth out and become the best in RoShamBo Arena!

Source: The Developer Website.

204301.name: Rabbit Island
204301.description:
User Summary

You make towers to defeat invading rabbits but also use "tower vs. tower mode" to defend and attack.

204302.description: This Expansion brings you 3 brand new Pets to use in your games: Jamon the boar, Cookie the fluffy kitty, and Neville the toad! Each of them comes with their Pet figure and Pet cards for all levels.
204302.name: Arcadia Quest: Pet Pack 1

204303.description: This Add-On brings 3 brand new Pets for you to chase down and add to your guilds: Wilhelm the goat, Joey the kangaroo, and Dawn the phoenix! Each of them comes with their Pet figure and cards for all levels.
204303.name: Arcadia Quest: Pet Pack 2

204304.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Nova
204304.description:
Description from the publisher:

Richard Rider is a middle-class man from the United States who became a member of the Nova Corps for which he gained superhuman abilities including enhanced strength, flight and resistance to injury. Calling himself "Nova," Rider is an inter-galactic peace-keeper. He is empowered by the Nova Force.

boardgameintegration: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Thames Murders & Other Cases
Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Thames Murders & Other Cases
204305.description:
Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: Jack the Ripper & West End Adventures is a standalone expansion to Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective with updated graphics that features ten more cases to be solved in Sherlock Holmes' Victorian-era London, England. A "London Directory", map, and newspaper archives are included with the cases.

Included are six independent "West End Adventures" cases (redesigned and updated from the 1995 expansion), and a series of four new cases based on the Jack the Ripper murders.

Jack the Ripper Cases:

Mary Ann Nichols
Annie Chapman
Elizabeth Stride, Catherine Eddowes
Mary Jane Kelly




West End Adventures:

The Strange Case of Dr. Goldfire
The Murder of Sherlock Holmes
A Case of Identity
The Death of a Transylvanian Count
A Royal Huggermugger at the Savage Club
A Simple Case of Murder
204305.name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: Jack the Ripper & West End Adventures
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 73 - Millennium Blades Three Year Anniversary

204306.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Black Panther
204306.description:
Description from the publisher:
T'Challa is a brilliant tactician, strategist, scientist, tracker and a master of all forms of unarmed combat whose unique hybrid fighting style incorporates acrobatics and aspects of animal mimicry. He fights to achieve his goals and protect the kingdom of Wakanda.

204307.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Incredible Hulk
204307.description:
Description from the publisher:

Dr. Bruce Banner's alter ego is the enormous, green skinned Hulk. His strength is limitless, he is practically indestructible and you won't like him when he's angry. He eats nuclear missiles for breakfast and can enter orbit in a single leap making him an invaluable addition to The Avengers. Now "HULK SMAAAASH!"

204309.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Vision
204309.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Vision is a synthetic android created by Ultron and Dr. Helen Cho, but programmed by Tony Stark and Bruce Banner by uploading the J.A.R.V.I.S. system for his personality. Placed within his forehead is the Mind Stone, one of the Infinity gems and provides him with his power. Vision is a polite, calm, and thoughtful being and unlike Ultron, he values life and humanity. Also Vision is one of only a handful of beings that are worthy enough to wield Mjolnir and with it the power of Thor. Visions capabilities include a Synthetic Body, Invulnerability, Density Manipulation, Superhuman Strength, Intangibility, Levitation, Interfacing with computers, Superhuman Speed, Shapeshifting, Energy Beams and of course the power from the Mind Stone.

204310.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Hawkeye
204310.description:
Description from the publisher:

Clinton Barton, code name Hawkeye, is a former S.H.I.E.L.D. agent and founding member of the Avengers. Barton has no real superpowers but is the world's greatest marksman armed with a recurve bow. Due to his work with shield, Hawkeye is has a very close friendship with Black Widow.

204311.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Iron Man Mk44 Hulkbuster Armor
204311.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Mark XLIV Armour, better known as the Hulkbuster, is Tony Stark's forty-fourth Iron Man suit, made with the help of Bruce Banner for use in case Banner lost control of his alter-ego, Hulk. It is a modular suit that is operated from within while being linked to the Mark XLIII Armour. This armour is launched from an orbital tracking platform, known as Veronica. This modular suit of armour has many of the traits of the classic Iron Man armour and a few impressive upgrades to take on the Incredible Hulk. These include, Advanced Strength, Advanced Durability, Flying, Repulsor Beams, Prehensile Technology, Grappling Hook, Extended Punches, Chemical Spray and Missiles.

204312.description:
Make your Marvel Universe games easier and show your opponents and yourself exactly who is hit with this Marvel Universe Spray Template.

Content:
One acrylic template.
boardgameaccessory: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Brotherhood of Evil Mutants Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Guardians of the Galaxy Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Avengers Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: X-Men Starter Set
204312.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Spray Template

204313.description:
Make your Marvel Universe games easier and show your opponents and yourself exactly what's going on at a glance with this Avengers Marker set, perfect to let you know exactly what mission objectives you need to achieve in game.

Contains 10x Avengers Markers, made in high quality plastic.
boardgameaccessory: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Avengers Starter Set
204313.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Avengers Markers

204314.name: The Dice Dungeon
204314.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Dice Dungeon is a race to be the first to find a route through a perilous dungeon. A brave adventurer, you will encounter monsters from terrible dragons guarding hoards of gold to pesky little orcs, ancient, undiscovered treasure chambers, cursed glyphs. Lots of stuff.

As you explore you also come across the items you need to get through and learn spells that can alter the very corridors in front of you. But beware; you are not the only one in the dungeon and your opponent will have a very different view of what it looks like…

You begin the game with an empty grid of thirty-six square holes (the Dungeon Waffle), plus a bag of thirty-six Dungeoneering Dice. The Dungeon Waffle is placed between you and your opponent, so each of you can see a different side of it. You then take it in turns to draw a die from the bag, roll it and use whatever you roll to either add to the dungeon map, alter the dungeon map or add to your resources.

Your aim is to score more experience points than your opponent over one or more games. During a game you try to map out a route on your side of the waffle from one edge to the other, and collect weapons and equipment to deal with whatever you might encounter on the way. When adding to the dungeon map you will change the map seen on both sides of the Dungeon Waffle, hopefully helping your route, while hindering your opponent’s.

204315.description:
Make your Marvel Universe games easier and show your opponents and yourself exactly what's going on at a glance with this Guardians of the Galaxy Marker set, perfect to let you know exactly what mission objectives you need to achieve in game.

Contains 10x Guardians of the Galaxy Markers, made in high quality plastic.
boardgameaccessory: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Guardians of the Galaxy Starter Set
204315.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Guardians of the Galaxy Markers

204316.name: Macho
204316.description:
Description from the publisher:

Toughest Card Game Around

A Party Favorite Card Game

MACHO... STRONG... COURAGEOUS...
that's what it takes to turn the next card in this exciting, fun game of cards.

The higher your score, the more MACHO it takes... Do you have it?

Any player starts the game by drawing and laying face up on the table one, or as many cards as he chooses, but he must draw at least one card. He may stop at any time. The points on each card are counted until the player stops, and are added to his score, unless he turns up a hog or a pig card during the draw. Hogs and Pigs can take away a player's points. Other MACHO cards can force a player to draw five cards with possibly devastating consequences. A game ends when a player scores 100 points or more. It's Press-Your-Luck-style gaming as you must choose carefully when deciding to draw the next card!

204317.description:
Make your Marvel Universe games easier and show your opponents and yourself exactly what's going on at a glance with this X-Men Marker set, perfect to let you know exactly what mission objectives you need to achieve in game.

Contains 10x X-Men Markers, made in high quality plastic.
boardgameaccessory: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Brotherhood of Evil Mutants Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: X-Men Starter Set
204317.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: X-Men Markers

204318.name: S and W Happy Marriage Game
boardgamepublisher: S and W Fine Foods Inc.
204318.description:
In the 1930s, canned food company S&W Fine Foods was the sponsor of a popular radio program called "I Want A Divorce", and in 1938 published a promotional board game called "S and W Happy Marriage Game".

The envelope used to ship the game says the show ran on eight radio stations in the Western U.S. and ran on the Columbia Broadcasting System on Sunday evenings at 7:30 Pacific and 8:30 Mountain. The board records the copyright date as 1938.

The game itself is a simple roll-and-move with a colorful folding cardboard game board. The theme is "happy marriage" and the track moves from "Proposal" to "Golden Anniversary at space 50.

The track is littered with squares representing personal faults like Jealousy, Excess, Gossip and Gambling that push players back, as well as virtues like Loyalty and Patience that move them forward. Square 24 is named "I Want a Divorce" after the radio program and sends players back to the start.

204319.name: Twister Ultimate
204319.description:
Description from the publisher:

Add a burst of fun into any party or family night with the hilarious game that ties players up in knots. The Twister Ultimate' game features a larger mat with 2 times the numbers of spots! You'll still enjoy classic Twister gameplay but now the game also features 2 special gameplay options that make it even more outrageous and fun. Choose to play Spot Elimination to lose a row and make the game more challenging, or play Spinner's Choice -- where the spinner chooses the next move. Play whichever way, but don't fall over. The last player standing wins!


Classic Twister gameplay
Features 2 gameplay options
Larger mat with more spots
The last player standing wins
Includes game mat, spinner board with arrow and base, and instructions (mat dimensions 64 inches x 93 inches).

204323.description:
Description from the publisher:

It’s the age of the next great space race and you are competing to see who will control the newest earth-like planet. Can you build the greatest planet structures and prove you have technological mastery over the planet?

Planet Rush is a fun euro game of bidding and building. You take control of one of five corporate factions, each bidding to contribute the most to the colonization of the planet. The one who builds the most on the planet wins and gets to claim majority ownership of the world itself!
204323.name: Planet Rush
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 68: Tuesday, September 20th

204324.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 197 - Jul 2016)
204324.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 197
July 2016

- Discover your destiny in a galaxy far, far away... with Star Wars: The Force Awakens beginner game

- Settle across the Americas with Catan Geographies: United States

204347.name: Rotten Core
204347.description:
Publisher blurb:

Rotten Core characters are dirty, rough, crazy, rotten individuals that live in a rotten world that makes them even more rotten. Characters pursue power so they can pander to their lowest instincts and act crazy while trying to access an inner talent for grotesque powers.

204348.name: The Slavers of Thin-gala
204348.description:
From the introduction:

The Duchy of LaGrange in the kingdom of Tanaska has a problem. Over the past few months, several of its coastal towns have been raided by pirate slavers. They have sacked the towns and taken most of the able-bodied men back aboard their ship in chains. There have been four raids to-date, each about 3 weeks apart, and over 100 people have been taken prisoner. The coastal towns have petitioned the Duke to do something to help but Reginald LaGrange, who is not exactly know for his compassion, has declined to intervene, claiming that without a naval force, there is nothing he can do. A petition for aid was also sent to the King, but the reply declared the problem to be an "internal matter" for the Duchy to deal with.

With no help forthcoming from any source, the many towns along the LaGrange coast are now living in fear, keeping a close watch on the seas, and preparing to run at the slightest hint of trouble. None of the villages are large enough to afford a mercenary protection force, and are too widely dispersed to band together for common defense. Some of the residents of these towns have moved away, but most have refused to leave, either because they are too stubborn to give up their homes without a fight, or because they have nowhere else to go.

User summary:

For 5th - 7th level characters

204349.name: The Nightstalker of Markesh
204349.description:
From the introduction:

The city of Markesh was founded eighty-five years ago.

It began when Agelmund Greybeard built his castle where the Annis River joins the mighty Mithil River.

Agelmund Greybeard was a strong, energetic man. He was also an ambitious man. Serving in the King’s army did little to satisfy his hunger for adventure and fame. Being born into the lower middle class gave him little hope of ever rising higher than the rank of captain, even though he was one of the most gifted men in the realm in the art of battle.

When Greybeard could take it no longer, he struck out on his own to find riches and wonders. He took with him a dozen good men from is company and they traveled west.

204350.name: The Stone Lord (1998)
204350.description:
From the introduction:

For the past six weeks, the good king Baedanfore's homeland has been plunged into turmoil. Freak events of weather have thrown off the normal peace and quiet of what should be a mild summer. Hailstones the size of boulders, savage whirlwinds that ravage the countryside, and even a snowstorm that lasted over a week are just a few of the events the realm has endured. The councilors of the kingly cloistered in their towers this evening, scrying and attempting to divine the origin of these phenomena. The king himself has not been idle. Wasting no time, the call has gone out.

User summary:

For 9th - 12th level characters. This scenario usually is distributed as a ZIP archive containing the DOC scenario and seven BMP image files (maps).

204351.name: The Vault of Evil Opened
204351.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is designed for 4-6 good-aligned characters of 6th to 9th level and is intended to introduce a new villain (Melengar) and a powerful evil artifact (the Rod of Ruin) into an ongoing campaign. As written, the PCs are not expected to encounter Melengar or the Rod of Ruin during the course of this adventure; rather, after completing this module, the PCs should be aware of the fact that some evil being has recovered an ancient and dangerous artifact. How much information the PCs learn of Melengar and the history of the Rod of Ruin during the course of this adventure is left to the DM, leaving open the opportunity for several follow-up adventures as the PCs try to gather information concerning their new foe and the artifact, eventually culminating in an epic assault on Melengar's labyrinthine catacombs. If, however, the DM wishes to run this adventure as a stand-alone module, then Melengar could be reduced in level, and the powers of the Rod adjusted to match the level and abilities of the PCs. If the DM chooses this approach, a suggested alternate ending is detailed at the end of the module.

User summary:

This item typically is distributed as a ZIP archive including the adventure document and two GIF image files (maps).

204352.name: The Vault of Time
204352.description:
From the introduction:

Long ago, a mage named Adder began an adventuring career. Unlike his companions (who sought gold and treasure), Adder adventured to further his pursuit of knowledge. He did not seek power or wealth, except where these tools could increase the information available to him. He and his companions grew powerful and wealthy, but while they spent their fortunes on life's finer pleasures, Adder spent his on books and scrolls. Adder would let little stand between himself and knowledge. A kind, patient man, he became intractable in his pursuit of ancient tomes. A small town, renowned for it's libraries, once denied Adder access to the information contained therein for political reasons. Adder, with the help of his companions, removed the mayor in a bloodless coup, and left him stranded in a town thousands of miles away. They then took over rule of the town.

User summary:

For 7th - 10th level characters. Usually distributed as a ZIP archive including the scenario document and nine JPG images (maps).

204353.name: Awesome Encounters Volume 1: Dungeon Levels 1-3
204353.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement will help you create fun and memorable dungeon encounters – encounters that your players will love! There is lots of great advice in the Dungeon Masters Guide, but it can take hours to understand and apply it all. We have done all of the hard work for you by pre-generating 300 separate monster encounters, all categorized by level and encounter difficulty, as well as creating dozens of treasure assortments.

We’ve also provided many tables to “spice up” your encounters, covering things such as dungeon architecture, monster actions and general dungeon dressing. In total, there are over 30 tables!

Using this supplement, you will be able to stock a dungeon with awesome encounters in just a few minutes.

204354.name: Affliction in Altmere
204354.description:
From the introduction:

A few days off the Triboar Trail, there exists a town whose inhabitants are oddly productive at their chosen professions, and where common disease and injury are relics of the recent past. What causes the woodcutter to be able to lift entire trees with a single arm? Why can the blacksmith laugh off the bite of a death dog?

Does Altmere’s gilded surface hide a rotten core? Every town holds its secrets, but can a band of outsiders discover the horrible truth in time to prevent something more sinister?

User summary:

For 2nd - 4th level characters.

204355.name: Cottage on the Long Road
204355.description:
From the introduction:

While traveling along the Long Road, just northeast of Waterdeep, the characters stop at a roadside inn. As they prepare to rest for the night, the party encounters a Tiefling shepherd who claims she is being harassed by the local farmers. Is this woman a target of bullying and prejudice, or is there something more sinister afoot at the Cottage on the Long Road?

User summary:

An introductory adventure for 1st - 3rd level characters. Contains extensive color maps with one inch grids, suitable for print-and-play.

204356.name: Monster in a Swamp
204356.description:
From the introduction:

This RPG Adventures scenario is a D&D 5th Edition Tier 1 scenario for characters of 1st-2nd level. Players can use their own characters, or the pre-generated ones presented with the Basic Rules . This scenario is designed to play in a 4-6 hour block of time – for use during an evening of gaming, during the slot at a convention, or an afternoon at your local hobby store.

Monster in a Swamp takes place in a small farming community (population: 75 – 100, with another 10 – 15 farming families within 20 miles) that borders a north-south river with an adjacent low-lying swamp. This area is also home to tribes of kobolds and goblin, though this can be substituted with other low-level creatures (1-2 hit dice) to better fit within a DM’s campaign.

204357.name: Balance Disturbed
204357.description:
Burning Destiny Campaign, Module 1

From the introduction:

The Riverlands Kingdom is a peaceful place. Generations ago
it was a thriving and rich trading empire, now it is a sleepy region of farms and a few craftsmen. Dotted with villages and a few towns along the numerous rivers, protected by a wall of rugged mountains, a wild forest and a vast steppe, little of note occurs here from generation to generation. All that is about to be shattered. An ancient evil has arisen and undertakes to bring wrath and destruction to the Riverlands in a pledge to conquer the rivers and kill those who reside between them...

User summary:

For 1st level characters. The scenario file usually is distributed with two ZIP archives containing color, high-definition maps.

204358.name: Deepwood Memorial
204358.description:
From the introduction:

Millennia ago, in a time remembered nowhere but in long forgotten books, there was an elven civil war in the Deepwood. It began as a land feud between two elven houses and raged for 103 years. Both sides suffered many casualties. Finally, a great king rose to power and brought an end to the war. To be sure future generations did not forget the cost of civil war, the king had a memorial built as a reminder of the price paid in blood. When the king died, he too was entombed in this memorial, in a secret chamber. The memorial has been abandoned by the elves for hundreds of years now. Since then, it has been looted and defaced by various vandals. Recently, a collapse in one of the rooms exposed a nearby cave system, and subsequently an Owlbear has made its nest here with its young.

204359.name: Pegasus (Issue 1 - Sep 2006)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204360.name: Pegasus (Issue 2 - Jan 2007)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204361.name: Pegasus (Issue 3 - Apr 2007)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204362.name: Beat Ninja
204362.description:
User Summary

Beat Ninja is a rhythm based VR game that has you cutting up music.

204363.name: Toys of War
204363.description:
The greatest military minds have gathered in an underground bunker to plan their next move. Take control of miniature military vehicles and battle your friends across a range of unique game modes. Plans are useful but it's quick thinking and a keen eye that will win the battle in Toys of War.

Source: The Developer Website.

204364.name: Aqua Moto Racing Utopia
204364.description:
Race through the waves of Utopia, make death defying stunts and get that much needed boost to pass your friends on the final stretch. Inspired by the classics we took a modern take on the genre with interactive waves, 1080p/60FPS and both. split screen and online racing!

Source: The Developer Website.

204365.name: Peanut Hunt
204365.description:
Who grabs all peanuts first?

Dexterity game for children:
Who will be the first player collecting 4 peanut chips of different colors with his elephant trunk?

204366.name: InCube
204366.description:
Description from the publisher:

InCube has you trapped! What seemed to be only an innocent game in a strange little box has now revealed itself to be a true nightmare! Stuck in this peculiar prison, you have to move in unison, rolling towards freedom — but be careful as only the one who ends up at the top of the cube will be able to escape from the game!

204367.name: Kor-Vademecum
204367.description:
User summary

A manual that provides all the information players need to add background and depth to their clerics of Kor, Demigod of battle and mercenaries. It includes prayers, canticles, rituals, holy books, and other background information on the cults of Kor.

204370.name: Crossroads: Temporal Mastery
204370.description:
Description from the designer:

Euro Game about time travelling, inverse-drafting card driven, resource management and victory points.

The game takes place in a fictional future in which there are multiple organizations who started time travelling to steal important goods and hire historical characters to their cause.

There are three turns, each divided into five rounds, and, at the end of a turn, a mutual resolution phase is played.

How a round is played: During rounds, players choose one of the two cards they own in their hands and pick one of the two sides in them. They then cover the other side of the card with an hand and show it at the same time as other players. Cards have an action resolution order, then the chosen card is passed to the left for a new round.

204371.name: Gun Done
204371.description:
User Summary

You face off in a duel with another shooter; there are different enemies/heroes and guns, each with its own advantages or challenges.

204372.name: Blockwick 2
204372.description:
User Summary

Match the Cyan Blue blocks by sliding and moving intermediary blocks around.

204373.name: Monopoly: Yu-Gi-Oh!
204373.description:
Description from the publisher:

Choose your favorite Millennium token and travel around the board collecting and trading Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters. To defeat your opponents, you will need to have the strongest monsters lke the Dark Magician, Exodia the Forbidden One, and the Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon. Upgrade with custom Game Shops and Duel Arenas to make yourself invincible.

204374.name: Ninja (1986)
videogameversion: Commodore & Atari diskette edition (black - joystick only)
Commodore & Atari diskette edition (gray - Joystick and keyboard)
204374.description:
User Summary
Originally labelled as Ninja for Commodore 64, but the year after labelled as Ninja Mission.

Back of Amiga game box

Of all the dangerous tasks given to the Ninja, this was to be the most perilous in their long history.

To enter the Temple of Death and regain the glowing idols stolen from the Princess by the Hordes of Darkness would call for all his skills in the art of combat, a fearless and resolute heart and the smile of fortune.

Ninja do not disobey the word of nobility, however, so taking up his weapons he makes his way to Torii to begin the mission...

Mind blowing graphics, stunning playability and a soundtrack to rock to, in the greatest martial arts game of them all - it blows the black belts of all the others!

Joystick required.

204375.name: Ninja Rabbits
204375.description:
Back of Amiga game box
Ninja Rabbits is an exciting multi-level all action arcade game. A leakage at a chemical factory has filled the World with deadly nerve gases. The animals and people have become aggressive. A Ninja Rabbit is the only hope if finding the leak and saving their World from destruction.

Fast Addictive Gameplay
Ninja Combat *Superb Graphics
Above & below ground action

204376.name: The Ascent
204376.description:
From the introduction:

Earth Date 2364.5: Captain’s Operations Log

We departed Lunar Colony Sigma at 0630 Lunar cycle, cadet crew performed a text-book launch and exceptional calculation of Lunar gravity to enter our shuttle into a stable orbit around the earth.
