The crew is of high spirits, having passed the Terran sling-shot maneuver in simulation a dozen times. They have the confidence and ease of a veteran bridge crew. I’m proud to call them my crew, and look forward to an easy journey free of incident.

204377.name: International Ninja Rabbits
204377.description:
Back of Amiga game box
International Ninja Rabbits is the sequel to the award winning and chart topping Ninja Rabbits game. In this continuing quest to rid the world of the deadly nerve gases the Ninja Rabbit encounters new and even more agressive animals and people than before. Guardian Angles, Chinese Dragons, Demented Pandas and Gighting Football Players are just some of the enemies the Rabbit must now overcome before the world is destroyed by the polluting and highly toxic gasses.
Fast Addictive Gameplay
Ninja Combat
Mystery Bonuses
Superb Graphics
Above & below ground action

204378.name: Lup
204378.description:
User Summary

A 2d platformer in which you can shoot a gun and do high jumping, going from area to area.

204379.name: Pegasus (Issue 4 - Jul 2007)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204380.name: The Balkan Tragedy 1912-1913
204380.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Balkan Tragedy is a one-two player game simulating the conflict in the balkans during both the first and second balkan war. This is a more traditional hex and counter War-Game and plays in 90-120 mins for each scenario. The first scenario being the first Balkan War, and the Second Balkan War being the other scenario included in the game. This game is meant to setup the background for our further exploration into the conflicts of the time period. Particularly WW1, as well as other post WW1, and inter war period conflicts. The game will feature a paper map, and units counters, and all necessary tracking counters for the game. Nations included in the game are: The Ottoman Empire, Bulgarians, Serbians, Greek, Romanian, and Montenegrin forces. This is your time to see if you can change history in the Balkans, and perhaps influence this critical region at this point in human history. Your the General now!!!

204381.name: Pegasus (Issue 5 - Oct 2007)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204381.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 5
Oktober 2007

Note - The PDF version distributed by the publisher does not include all of the pages in the physical copy of the same issue.

204382.name: P.P. Hammer And His Pneumatic Weapon
204382.description:
Back of game boxes
Meet P.P. - a man with a mission. Help him clear out over 2500 screen of treasure, potions, and secret rooms before his time runs out! With 70 caverns to work through, from cold ice caves to sizzling pyramids, it's just as well P.P. has brought his secret weapon - a pneumatic drill! Plenty of features and puzzles will ensuure that you need all your wits in this fast moving action adventure

204383.name: Pegasus (Issue 6 - Dec 2007)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204384.name: Pegasus (Issue 7 - Mar 2008)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204385.name: Pegasus (Issue 8 - Jun 2008)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204385.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 8
Juni 2008

Note - The PDF version distributed by the publisher does not include all of the pages in the physical copy of the same issue.

204386.name: Party Games
204386.description:
User Summary
Rumoured to be published in 1989. This is a freeware sex game, developed by Modedeal.

Also known as Summer Night Games, which might have been released in 1988.

204387.name: Cavern Run 64
204387.description:
User Summary

Cavern Run 64 finds you piloting a spacecraft through a mine and moving left and right to avoid the scrolling cavern walls.

204388.name: Krazy Kong
204388.description:
User Summary

Krazy Kong is a platformer based on Donkey King. You must rescue maidens at the top of a screen from a giant ape.

You start at the bottom and run up platforms diagonally avoiding barrels.

204389.name: Alien Panic 64
204389.description:
User Summary

Alien Panic is a platformer where you guide three aliens down off of scaffolding using ladders. Aliens are pushed down through levels by digging holes and sending aliens down into the holes to push them through to the bottom.

204390.name: Pegasus (Issue 9 - Oct 2008)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204391.name: Pegasus (Issue 10 - Dec 2008)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204391.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 10
Desember 2008

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204392.name: THE REBEL
204392.description:
The Rebel is all about shooting, having fun and enjoying nice graphics.

Source: The Game Website.

204393.name: Pegasus (Issue 11 - Apr 2009)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204393.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 11
April 2009

Note - The PDF version distributed by the publisher does not include all of the pages in the physical copy of the same issue.

204394.name: Pegasus (Issue 12 - Jul 2009)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204394.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 12
Juli 2009

Note - The PDF version distributed by the publisher does not include all of the pages in the physical copy of the same issue.

204395.name: Bedroom Olympics
204395.description:
User Summary
Sexual themed "1988 Seoul Olympic" joystick waggler: Yank your joystick left and right to get the moves of your participants to fulfil the shagometer and maybe even get the record.

A freeware Amiga game

204396.name: Fightbox
204396.description: User summary: A fighting game where you custom build your character before fighting. Based on the BBC television show of the same name.

204397.name: Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Storm of Sigmar
boardgameintegration: Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Spire of Dawn
Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Spire of Dawn
204397.description:
Description from the publisher:

Containing everything you need to get started with exciting games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar, this box is the perfect starting point. Two powerful forces – the heroic Stormcast Eternals and Khorne’s unstoppable Bloodbound – meet in savage combat to control the destiny of the mortal realms!

In this box, you’ll find all the items you need to start playing games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar:

Miniatures

3 Stormcast Eternals Liberators: steel-souled heroes of Order, hurled down from the skies to meet Chaos head-on;
2 Stormcast Eternals Retributors: clutching weapons forged of ensorcelled sigmarite, they call upon bursts of violent sky magic;
3 Khorne Bloodbound Blood Warriors: muscled, aggressive fighters who shrug off even the most powerful blows, such is their bloodlust;
5 Khorne Bloodbound Bloodreavers, mortal followers of the Blood God, eager to prove their worth through slaughter.

Gaming Content

The box comes with a guidebook containing:

an introduction to the world of Warhammer Age of Sigmar – who are the Stormcast Eternals, who are the Khorne Bloodbound, and why are they sworn to destroy one another?
all the rules you need in order to play games right away, in an easy to follow format;
4 Battleplans – scenarios for your games, featuring special rules and new ways to play: destroy all your foes, protect a specific miniature or fend off waves of increasingly powerful enemies, with victory conditions, objective and tips simply explained;
4 large-format Warscroll cards - these are handy reference cards featuring the rules and abilities your miniatures can call upon, featuring striking artwork;
a rangefinder printed on the back of the book, and 7 dice to make the fateful rolls that will decide who is the victor and who will be annihilated;
hints and tips on where to go next – how to expand your Stormcast Eternals and Khorne Bloodbound armies, where to get Citadel paint sets with which to paint them, and which books from the range will help you to bring the mortal realms to life on your gaming table.

The box also contains a construction guide designed to make assembling your miniatures easy to assemble, and enough Citadel 32mm and 40mm Round bases to stand them on.

204398.name: Pegasus (Issue 13 - Sep 2009)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204398.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 13
September 2009

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204399.name: Phase Four
204399.description:
User summary:

Character generations uses random rolls to select traits and ability scores. Characters are defined by Origin; Attributes (Combat, Strength, Toughness, Reflexes, Insight, Knowledge, and Ego - abbreviated as "Combat S.T.R.I.K.E."); Skills; and Powers. Action resolution uses a few color-coded action tables and modified dice rolls. A wide variety of supernatural power options is provided.

204400.name: The Moving Picture Game
204400.description:
This is a simple but colorful game designed by Howard R. Garis (creator of Uncle Wiggily). The box cover has an illustration of people lining up at a movie theatre box office, which shows the day's feature as a Charlie Chaplin movie. The playing board is laminated to the bottom of the box, and is set up like a theatre, with 11 rows of seats and a centre aisle.

The rules are pasted on the inside of the lid, and describe a spin-and-move effort to weave through the seats all the way to the stage. The winner gets to shake hands with the hero and heroine of the movie, who have appeared that night in person. The 131-space track includes 13 seats with hazards such as "You sat in gum, lose 1 turn" and six seats with bonuses such as "Somebody eats peanuts, go to 48".

204401.name: Breakout Day
204401.description:
From the introduction:

Main Plot: The call center CEO is working towards his master plan, which is to make the Call of C’Thulhu. This training session is when he will introduce this new call. It is the culmination of his life’s work. But four university student researchers are stumbling close to the truth, and may have the power to set the plans awry. Meanwhile, the consultant is firing all those unsuitable to make the call, starting with the geeks.

User summary:

The LARP is comprised of these documents:

- Breakout Day (42-page PDF core rules)
- Extra Characters (7-page PDF accessory characters)
- Introduction (2-page PDF introduction for players)
- Props (12-page PDF prop list and instructions)

204402.name: Myth: MERCS Recon Kickstarter Rewards
204402.description:
This is a set of Kickstarter Exclusive rewards for Myth that was part of the MERCS: Recon Kickstarter. These were stretch goals that were unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign and were part of the "Myth Pledge Level" and "Agent Pledge Level" (and higher pledge levels).

This set includes the following miniatures with associated cards:


Inquisitor Alger (Agent)
Hunter (Hero; 2 figures: Male and Female)
X-3ONE (Mini-Boss)
Infected (4 figures)


The Agent Hero, X-3ONE Mini-Boss, and Infected may also be used with MERCS: Recon and include cards for both Myth and MERCS: Recon. The Infected are the same as the Infected in the MERCS: Recon - Blood Contagion expansion (which is a Myth Crossover).

204403.name: All-American Football Game
204403.description:
This 1935 title uses dice to determine the results of plays. The board has two folds, with the field in the center section and the list of plays and results, and dials for downs, quarters and yards to go on both side panels, one facing each end of the field.

Kickoff, return, reverse, lateral, line buck, off tackle, end run, pass, punt and spinner plays are resolved with two dice which are read lowest digit first, for 21 possible outcomes. Results of punts, field goals, try for point, free kick after safety, fumbles, blocked kicks and interference penalties are determined by a single die.

There is no defensive play choice. Instead, the defensive player is responsible for looking up the results and keeping tabs of yardage and downs while the offensive player considers his next play. The offensive player must choose his next play within 10 seconds or is hit with a five-yard delay of game penalty.

204404.name: Breeding Season
204404.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Breeding Season is the unholy combination of a farming sim and a sex game. Breed a variety of sexy monsters together for sale to adventurous clients.

Source: The Developer Blog.

204405.name: Visualise
204405.description: Test your observation and attention to detail. Look at the picture. You have 30 seconds to memorise as much as possible and then be prepares to answer questions about the picture. Each correct answer earns you 1 point. After three rounds of pictures the player with the most points wins!

204406.description:
Description from the publisher (translated):
A Demonark of the Wizardking Marda came close to the coast of Aventuria. On board is a black diamond - the source of breeding demons and undeads. You must stop the ship of the lost souls, bevor it can reach the shore und the monsters can attack the land.

Das Schiff der verlorenen Seelen ("The ship of the lost souls") is an expansion to the adventure game Aventuria. In addition to the three act adventure Ship of the lost souls, this box contains a short adventure called Rietholtz’ treasure. You can find also a new hero called Tjalva Garheltdottir, a mighty warrior from Thorwal.

Description from the publisher:
Eine Dämonenarche des Zauberkönigs Marda nähert sich der aventurischen Küste. An Bord befindet sich ein Schwarzer Diamant – eine Brutstätte für Dämonen und Untote. Ihr müsst Das Schiff der verlorenen Seelen aufhalten, bevor es das Festland erreicht und die Ungeheuer aus seinem Innern über das Land herfallen.

Das Schiff der verlorenen Seelen ist eine Erweiterung für Aventuria - Das Abenteuerkartenspiel. Neben dem Abenteuer Das Schiff der verlorenen Seelen mit drei Akten, ist das Kurzabenteuer Rietholtz’ Schatz in dieser Box enthalten. Außerdem wird ein neuer Held eingeführt: Tjalva Garheltdottir, eine Thorwalsche Kriegerin, die ihrer überlegenen Körperkraft und ihren mächtigen Waffen vertraut, um ihre Feinde zu zerschmettern.

Ein neuer Held mit Lebenspunkteanzeiger und 30 Aktionskarten
90 Abenteuerkarten (mit Anführern, Schergen, Belohnungen u.v.m.) und neue Spezialmarken
Ein Heft mit Regeln und Abenteuern
204406.name: Aventuria: Das Schiff der verlorenen Seelen
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

boardgamepublisher: 新ボードゲーム党 (New Board Game Party)
204407.description:
User summary
トイレを汚したのは誰だ? (Toire o Yogoshita nowa Dareda) in English means 'Who Soiled the Toilet?'

Who Soiled the Toilet? is a deduction game with hidden identities. The game box is 15cm round, not square. The game is published in Japanese with rules available in English, German and French.

At beginning of the game, each player is dealt one secret identity card, which is either a clean keeper or a soiler. They play five rounds. The soilers win the game if the toilet is soiled three times out of these five rounds. Otherwise the clean keepers win.

A round is either a regular round or an action round. In a regular round, a leader sends a certain number of players to the toilet in order. The toilet is initially clean (clean side of the toilet card is up), but when a soiler enters the toilet, that player may soil the toilet, secretly flipping the toilet card to dirty-side-up. After all designated players are done, The toilet card is revealed to all players. Soilers win the round if the toilet is dirty. Players should discuss and deduce who are the soilers.

In an action round, place the toilet bowl (the game box) on the table, and players take turns trying to throw a poo chip into the toilet bowl from two-card length away. The clean keepers win the round if a certain number of poo chips are in the toilet bowl. Otherwise the soilers win that round. Players should discuss who missed the throw intentionally.

It is recommended the toilet card be placed on an actual toilet because it adds more reality and laughter to players' conversation. To do so, keep the toilet clean, of course!

Publisher's summary
トイレを綺麗に使う側と汚す側の２チームに分かれて行う正体隠匿系のゲームです。５ラウンド行い３ラウンド勝利したチームが勝ちます。通常ラウンドではリーダーが選んだ人物が順番にトイレに向かいます。最後に皆で確認して、よろれていた場合は誰がトイレを汚したのかを議論します。ACTIONラウンドでは全員がウンコチップを便器型の箱に投げて乗せます。外れたらトイレが汚れ汚れてしまいますが、わざと汚したのか失敗したかを読み取って議論します。実際にトイレを使って遊ぶととても盛り上がる楽しいゲームです。とても笑えるゲームです。
204407.name: Toire o Yogoshita nowa Dareda?
boardgamepodcastepisode: 19. Devon Dice Dreaming to Essen trip 2016, Top 10 wants to Buys

204408.name: Pegasus (Issue 14 - Dec 2009)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204408.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 14
Desember 2009

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204409.name: Pegasus (Issue 15 - Apr 2010)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204409.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 15
April 2010

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

boardgamepublisher: 新ボードゲーム党 (New Board Game Party)
204410.description:
User summary
貨モッツァ (Kamottsa) is Kamozza. In the game of Kamozza, you are exporters and your goal is to load as much of your freight as possible into ships.

At the beginning of the game, each player has the same set of freight cards of various loads.

There are two docks on the table. Each round, two ships come into these docks. The one of these two ships has larger load capacity, and the other has smaller. Then each player secretly chooses a freight card from their hand and destination ship to load the freight. When they are revealed, count up the load for each ship. If the load exceeds the ship's capacity, the ship is sunk. Otherwise freight is successfully loaded and victory points are scored to the successful players.

After the fifth round, the highest scorer wins the game.

This game is simple but exciting, and its artwork is cute. You can play another game using the same cards. You should load your freight from heavier to lighter, but if you and other player play the same card, both cards cancel each other and you miss a chance to load. This game is also exciting.

The game was originally produced in 2012 in Japanese. A new edition has been made for Spiel 2016 with rules available in English, German and French (game-play being language independent).

Publisher's summary
輸出業者となって積み荷を船に載せるカードゲームです。２つの港があり大きな船と小さな船が其々の港に着きます。船の大きさに限度があるのでプレイヤーは他のプレイヤーの裏をかき人の少ない港を目指すことが重要です。船の大きさを超えて積み荷が乗ると船は沈んでしまうでしょう。シンプルで盛り上がるゲームです。絵柄もカワイイと評判です。また、同じカードを使ってもう一種類のゲームを楽しめるのも特徴です。もう１つはバッティングゲームです。大きな荷物から船に載せますが、同じ積み荷は無効になってしまいます。こちらもエキサイティングですよ。
204410.name: Kamozza (貨モッツァ)

204411.name: Lost in Paradise
204411.description:
User Summary

You survive a Caribbean shipwreck to point and click your way through puzzles and clues.

204412.description:
Farmers’ Market Rally is a set collection game of seasonal local produce and high scores and is for two to four people, aged eight and above. The game is set at your local farmers’ market, where you’ve met up with some friends to search for items on your shopping list and collect anything else in season this week.

For the number of players plus two, two rows of card stacks are dealt to create farmer's stands. Players take turns picking from the dealt stands, with new cards replaced after each turn. Two rounds of stands are available with surprises waiting to be found in the back of the second-row stands after players have made their most of their first-row purchases. The game continues until one of the second-row stands has sold-out, with one turn left for the remaining players.

There are thirteen item card types and 94 total items in the deck, plus ten shopping list cards.
204412.name: Farmers' Market Rally

204413.name: Roan
204413.description:
Pulp-style adventure in a world of brightly-colored ponies and other fantastic creatures inspired by My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, but with a very different feel.

From the back cover:

Now hear this, Ponies of Roan!

Venture forth and rediscover a lost world—help to reclaim the forgotten in this action-packed game of adventure.

A world changed by magic. A legacy hidden in shadow. A nation of ponies reborn, with the threat of an empire reaching out with iron claws to hold them and the world in its grasp.

Pony adventurers, can you answer the call of duty to defend your nation? To rediscover the lost, and to reclaim what was stolen?

Find out in Roan as you journey from the urban to the wilds.

204414.name: Pegasus (Issue 16 - Sep 2010)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204414.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 16
September 2010

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204415.name: Alien Passion Disaster
204415.description:
From the game:

The game plays out in a series of scenes. In each scene, the involved players declare what their intentions of their factions or characters from it are and then bid on controlling the narrative outcome. These scenes will have narrative repercussions, most of which will be written on the cards as they are played out. Likewise, things that happen in earlier scenes should influence the outcome of future scenes - despite the rigid turn structure, the story continues across the entire game.

User summary:

The game requires two packs of standard French playing cards. The cards are defaced during play.

204416.name: War of the Dead: Chapter Four (Collected)
204416.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Requires all previous chapters of War of the Dead

The survivors of the Pinnacle cruise ship have traveled half-way across the country and survived impossible odds. From confronting the Living Dead, to facing cannibals, to escaping Edward Russo and his army of thousands of Living Dead, the characters have become legends to those aware of their exploits.

Currently trapped inside the Federal Correctional Facility hidden away near the Citizen Relocation Zone in Colorado, the characters must once again perform the impossible if they are to survive. Forced to flee and seek refuge, they are poorly equipped and ill prepared for the array of threats that confront them.

The saga continues in War of the Dead: Chapter Four (To Reign in Hell). War of the Dead brings the zombie apocalypse to the award winning Savage Worlds role-playing game, broken down into 4 chapters of 13 adventures each.

Chapter Four concludes the saga as the characters uncover the secrets of the government shadow war, the history of the Living Dead, and of an insane experiment that could once again change the entire world. Forced into a final confrontation with a secretive government agency, as well as the outlaws that control Helltown, the characters find themselves in a position to affect the future of the human race— or die trying.

This book contains all 13 adventures of Chapter Four, bringing your War of the Dead campaign to its conclusion!

204417.name: Field Work
204417.description:
From the introduction:

This is a roleplaying game for 3 - 4 players that deals with fixing computers, inept monsters from beyond the veil of sanity, and situations rapidly escalating to the point of crisis. You’re going to love it!

User summary:

This game was the winner of the #Threeforged RPG Design Challenge.

204418.name: Winter Eternal
204418.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Winter Eternal is not a post apocalyptic setting. It's about what comes after the disaster, many years later when civilization is starting to thrive again.

When the sun exploded, the continent of Ehlerrac survived the wave of flames because it was on the night side of the planet. Then the earthquakes and tsunamis hit and thousands died as cities fell and the landscape were torn apart. The dark world started cooling rapidly and the survivors struggled to find food and shelter.

A group of Nature Wardens started camps and used their magic to grow food. People of many different races came stumbling out of the darkness into these camps, grateful for the protection.

Now, hundreds of years later, the 6 camps are giant, cramped cities, heated and lit by magic. Two cities are underground and one is build on the inside edges of a chasm. The cities are now connected by enclosed roads called Archways and travel is now much safer.

A few years ago explorers came upon orange crystals in an old crater. When light shone on the crystals, it generated a massive amount of heat. Artificers are now using these "sunshards" to help Ehlerrac to take it's first tentative steps into an industrial and steam age.

This is an exciting time on Ehlerrac and its up to Savage worlds game groups to tell the stories of this dark, cold, but not dead world.

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
204420.description:
Description from the publisher:

A rising tide lifts all boats, and in New Bedford that means the town is ready to grow.

Rising Tide is an expansion for New Bedford that includes more ships and supplies for a fifth captain, and even more buildings to expand the town. Ships at sea will have tales to tell from the Ship's Log, and while Providence favors the bold, darker Omens are also on the horizon...
204420.name: New Bedford: Rising Tide

204421.name: Into the Sunset
204421.description:
From the introduction:

Into The Sunset is played in chunks of roleplay called scenes. A scene represents a piece of story that would take about five to ten minutes to play out in a movie. They’re shorter than your average roleplaying game scene; while a scene will probably take a little longer to play out in the game than it would take to show on the screen, you want to keep them to about ten or fifteen minutes at the most.

204422.name: Fury
204422.description:
A Streamlined Approach to Tabletop Gaming

Publisher blurb:

The world of Fury is one where fighters, with the help of technology, have broken through to an almost superhuman level - surpassing the deadliness of almost all weaponry known to Earth. Your adventures will see you traveling to exotic locations, reaching past your limits, and testing your mind and body against the world’s more dangerous warriors. The game is focused on fast and streamlined play where your heroes are free to do what they want without requiring long periods of rule book reference. While using some tried and true mechanics such as skills, Fury features several changes from the d20 system that are designed to increase the tempo of play and create a more frantic and exciting setting for adventuring.

204423.name: Atropos
204423.description:
From the game:

The gods are neither Omniscient or Omnipresent. They do not know everything that happens and they are not everywhere at once. Also, They are not all powerful, only vastly powerful. You can lead a perfectly happy life without following any of the gods.

204424.name: Caloreimus: The Red Dawn
204424.description:
From the introduction:

The Red Dawn is set on the continent of Caloreimus, formerly a peaceful realm, and heart of The One World. It is bordered with the cold, North lands of Zylbour, and is home to the great god, Lothar.

After the death of King Tarnis, Caloreimus suffered by the
hands of a deceitful prince, Falcon Dan. In his quest for power, Falcon awakened the interests of the sleeping armies, who have patiently waited for the collapse of organized society.

User summary:

The ruleset largely is derived from a previous live-action roleplaying game titled Castleland Live! which was, in turn, derived from a long running tabletop RPG campaign.

204425.name: Fruit Case
204425.description:
In Fruit Case, players attempt to collect sets of fruit to fill their baskets. Points are awarded for complete and partial sets.

The game contains 108 cards with identical backsides. On the front are the following:

12 each of six different fruits
24 baskets with two fruits (blue background)
4 wild pineapples (purple background)
2 baskets with 3 fruits (purple background)
2 bombs (purple background)
1 rotten apple with a worm (purple background)
3 tree cards (brown background)




The tree cards are laid face up in the middle, with at most one less than the number of players. Each player receives a two-fruit basket to start with and all other cards are shuffled. The starting dealer lays out, face up, a number of cards equal to the number of players. In turn, beginning with the dealer, each player chooses a card and places it in front of them. A player not wishing or unable to take a card instead takes one of the trees (if one is available in the middle). This tree may be returned to the center on a subsequent turn in order to take any fruit from the discard pile (instead of taking a card from the middle).

Each basket starts with two or three fruits already in it. A fruit card can only be added to the basket if that fruit is not yet present. Once a basket has all six fruits, all of its cards are stacked and turned sideways. Any number of baskets can be worked on at one time, but a fruit cannot be taken without a basket to go in.

The pineapple is a wild fruit, but each basket can only have one. If the bomb comes up in a deal, the entire turn is skipped and all cards from the middle are discarded. The rotten apple results in the dealer discarding one entire incomplete basket of theirs, if one exists.

After each round, the dealer role passes to the left. The game ends when there are not enough cards to fill the center. 5 points are awarded for each complete basket, with 1 point for each fruit card added to an incomplete basket.

Rules are also included for longer and shorter variants.

204426.name: STÅRGÅTE LÅRP
204426.description:
From the introduction:

Stårgåte Live Åction Role Plåying (Stargate LÅRP) is designed as a 24 hour time in style system. Within that time there is Uptime when the characters are actively on missions, and Soft Time, when the characters are based at the gate command. It is possible for players to go off base (out of character) during this time. If you want to leave you must notify the base staff they are leaving and change out of costume. It is vital that the organizers know who is and is not on site at all times.

204427.name: Ready or Not
204427.description:
Description from the publisher:

"Players create numeric patterns (sequences and series like 1,2,3,4 or 2,4,6,8 etc.) much like they would create words while playing Scrabble. There is an amazing number of possibilities, a lot of fun and all players compete equally while receiving play money as they show off their creative ability."

Each player starts with $1000 and 7 numeric tiles. On a player's turn they must create a numeric pattern using at least 3 of their 7 tiles. Points scored are equal to the sum of the numbers played, multiplied by the number of tiles played. Additional tiles can be purchased with game money. Additional money can be earned by creating a pattern where the sum of the numbers is equally divisible by the number of tiles played. The game ends when no more tiles are remaining. The player with the most points is the winner.

204428.name: Pegasus (Issue 17 - Mar 2011)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204428.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 17
Mars 2011

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204429.description:
More Bloody Nights, a standalone expansion for Noches de Sangre (Bloody Nights), is a semi-cooperative card game in which players have to survive a vampire attack over thirty nights. Each turn, players can pick up some items to be stronger, rescue survivors to join their team, find food to feed them, and even get inside new buildings to search for new adventures! But take care of your belongings as the world is full of pickpockets. With this new expansion, some players will also transform into vampires.

After a player's turn, vampires will attack the group, so be ready! Roll a d6 and try to hit them as strongly as you can. If you fail, be prepared to suffer consequences...

Surviving until the sun comes out is not enough: the one who rescued more people will be the winner. Who will it be?
204429.name: More Bloody Nights

204430.name: Auction House
204430.description:
In Auction House is a classic auction game. Players take on the role of potential bidders, as they bid over lots based on some of highest value items ever sold in real auctions.

Auction House is simple bidding game made of two decks the auction items and the cash cards. Players all start with the same amount of cash and bid in secret on items.

Once revealed the highest bidder wins. Play continues until all players run out of cash cards to bid. At the end of the game the player with the most items is declared the winner.

204431.description:
One Night Ultimate Alien is similar to other One Night Ultimate... titles in that players each secretly take a role as part of a team, but this time the roles all relate to aliens.

One Night Ultimate Alien can be combined with any other One Night Ultimate... game.
204431.name: One Night Ultimate Alien
boardgamepodcastepisode: 17. Devon Dice podcast Room Escaping, Surfing, Murder, space surviving and Klask...
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 027 – End of Year One
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 036 – Blood Rage vs Scythe

204432.name: COME ON OVER!
204432.description:
One player is in a tricky situation and is looking for a solution. The other players have to invent a story around one bizarre fact that will convince the first player to come to their country to solve the problem. If your country is chosen, you receive the situation card. Whoever collects the most cards wins the game.

Who will come up with the craziest story?
Which countries do those weird facts belong to?

Including more than a hundred surprising facts about the 28 EU countries and thousands of possibilities for fun stories, COME ON OVER! is the perfect entertaining game about Europe.

204433.name: Pegasus (Issue 18 - Jun 2011)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204433.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 18
Juni 2011

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204434.name: Bard Tales
204434.description:
From the introduction:

Whether you are an apprentice just learning your craft, or a seasoned bard who has performed before kings, this small book will prove both useful and amusing.

Within these pages you will find a collection of my favorite riddles, jokes, poems, ballads, songs, fables, stories and insults. With these you will delight your companions, confound your neighbors and infuriate your adversaries. Please enjoy!

User summary:

Should not be confused with the similar but distinct Bard's Tales.

204435.name: Bard Tales Volume 2
204435.description:
From the introduction:

My first little book proved so popular that my publisher has pressed me to produce another. It seems that there are many aspiring bards out there – as well as some established ones looking for a little bit of help.

Fortunately, I have plenty more material to share! Within these pages you will find a peerless collection of riddles, comic stories, fables, poems, jokes, songs, ballads, shanties, maxims, sayings, insults, riddles and rhymes. I trust you will enjoy them all!

User summary:

Should not be confused with the similar but distinct Bard's Tales II.

204436.name: Talona's Touch: Poisons of the Forgotten Realms
204436.description:
From the introduction:

The annals of the Realms are filled with stories of deadly poisonings and the changes they have wrought to kingdoms and those who dwell within them. Loremasters and sages continue to keep alive the tales of such legendary figures as King Jhaster II of Ammarindar who fell to the poisoned arrows of the orcs of the Blacktusk Horde or the giant chieftain Kormuk of the Lone Mount, slain after partaking of cattle carcasses liberally poisoned by the adventuring band known as the Company of the Stormsword.

204437.name: Guild of Wintercrest
204437.description:
From the introduction:

In the frozen reaches of the High Ice, beyond the scorching sands of the Anauroch, lies a land of icy beauty. Long ago, the enigmatic Frostlash the Ice Mage established a small fortress in the High Ice dedicated to teaching future generations exquisite magical arts harnessing the power of the snow and cold. The Guild of Wintercrest was established, but since Frostlash’s disappearance the guild has become isolated, jealously guarding its secrets. Come now and get a look into the Guild of Wintercrest - its history, its leaders, membership benefits, and adventure hooks!

204438.name: Plane View: Elemental Fire
204438.description:
From the introduction:

The Inner Planes are dangerous places at the best of times, filled with all manner of terrible creatures and natural events meant to destroy unexpected travelers. But there are treasures out there, glorious and powerful, hiding away tucked into the far corners. The Plane of Elemental Fire holds many secrets, from the halls of the City of Brass to the Volcano of the Destroyer and beyond.

204439.name: Pirate Adventurers
204439.description:
From the introduction:

With Pirate Adventures you can provide your players with new player character options for 5th edition to create pirate themed characters. These options can be used to play an entire campaign in a pirate setting, or just to provide a player with more pirate flavored options than provided by core 5th edition materials. Allow your players to dive into custom backgrounds, equipment, feats and shipboard roles created just for their swashbuckling pirates and privateers.

204440.name: Weary Donkey: Tavern and Inn
204440.description:
From the introduction:

The Weary Donkey is a staple in these parts. A common place for travelers to stay the night and for locals to get together and drink the worries of the day away.

A location for any level character.

204441.name: In Darkest Warrens
204441.description:
(publisher blurb)

IN DARKEST WARRENS is a minimalist fantasy roleplaying game whose rules cover two pages, including a bestiary and introductory adventure. All you need is some six-sided dice, paper, pencils and, of course, a bunch of buddies to play with.

So what do you get?

All the rules you need, including character advancement for campaign play
Five classes: warrior, rogue, barbarian, mage and ranger
A bestiary containing 23 fiendish monsters to throw at your players
Super easy resolution system - all you need is a single d6
A character sheet
An introductory adventure: The Cow of Boburn
Hours of enjoyment in a small package

Print the rules right out and use them for reference at the table. Perfect for a pick-up and play game.

204442.name: Rifts: The Tomorrow Legion Player's Guide
204442.description:
From the back cover:

A Megaverse Gone Mad!

Prepare yourself for a railgun-shredding, mega-powered magic flinging journey into a post-post-apocalyptic world where supernatural horrors vie with technological empires for master of the world.

This is the world of RIFTS.

Unpredictable holes in the very fabric of space and time open the way to countless creatures, beings, and dangers. Whatever you imagine - whatever you fera - it's somewhere in this war-and-chaos ravaged world.

The Tomorrow Legion is Ready.

In the battle for survival, the Tomorrow Legion brings together the greatest, the bravest, and the craziest to stand against an infinity of threats. They stand for a better future than the past they've known.

204443.name: Alchemist (5e)
204443.description:
From the introduction:

The Alchemist offers a new class to your players that crosses the boundaries between science and magic. In addition to the core alchemist class, this supplement provides seven alchemical traditions that emulate archetypes from Dr. Jekyll to Dr. Frankenstein.

204444.description:
You and your fellow players are officers trying to save yourselves and some passengers but there is only one last lifeboat remaining, eventually fighting for life. That last lifeboat has a limited number of places...

Players use their action cubes to determine:

the turn order (it also allows to get courage or money)
the distance their officer walk. Each one has a list of rooms he must go through before he can leave the sinking boat.
the money they want to get (it helps to get objects and passengers)
the courage they want to get (useful in order to move further and guide passengers)
if they want to get an object (useful when fighting)
if they want the buoy (to go through a room that has got the water leak)




-*if they want passengers

Then the water leak moves from one room to another. The buoy comes handy there. If an officer is in that same room, he must go back on his rooms list.

Then actions are taken.

Fights are resolved when several officers are in the same room. Passengers and collected objects are used to calculate the force of each opponent's group.

When each officer arrives at the end of his list, he finally moves into the lifeboat. He takes as many places for his passengers as he can, if remaining.

The game ends when the lifeboat is full.
The winner is the player who could save the most passengers.
204444.name: Le dernier canot du Titanic

204445.name: Pegasus (Issue 19 - Oct 2011)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204445.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 19
Oktober 2011

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204446.name: Pegasus (Issue 20 - Dec 2011)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204446.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 20
Desember 2011

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204447.name: Keeping Counsel
204447.description:
From the introduction:

The people of the Queendom do not think of themselves as one blood; only now, under her sagacious rule, they put aside their feuds. Through conquest, diplomacy, and spell-craft, your liege has united ancient foes: the far-riders of the veld, the pike-women of the crags, the merchant-lords of the Three Jeweled Cities. They do not love one another, but they respect the queen—or fear her.

You have an Office within her court—and with that title comes both Duties and Rights. Your liege will keep your counsel, for those seated around her are her trusted viziers; you may lead her into majesty or madness—but there can never be an easy, perfect peace. You must balance the Favor of the people, the Will of the gods, and the Demands of neighbor-states eager to seize mastery over all that your liege has built.

204448.name: Magical Mystery Tour
204448.description:
From the introduction:

This is a game for 4-6 players. Over the course of a 3-hour session you will tell the story of an amazing band trying to change the world with their music while trying to walk a path between idealism and realism.

Most of you will play the band – gifted individuals brought together by music and friendship, but with your own dreams and drives pulling you in different directions.

One of you will play the Light – the supernatural force of radiance and change that is the character’s staunch ally and source of their magical musical powers. Your job is to track the character’s balance between the Light’s ideals and the World’s vices.

The last one will play the World. It’s your job to place obstacles between the band and their goals, and to present them with conflicts that test their dedication to the band and to the Light.

204449.name: Among Humans
204449.description:
From the introduction:

I am monster. I look like you. I talk like you, mostly. But inside I am different, and that makes your world dangerous for me. You would catch me. You would kill me. Worse, you would hold me down and stick me, test me, hurt me. Life among humans is hard.

A storytelling game about passing in society, paranoia, and deep, deep longing.

204450.name: Transmission
204450.description:
From the introduction:

The game is divided into two parts: the Transmission Phase, in which the players create a number of transmissions from the colony detailing their discoveries and experiences as they make a new life on this planet; and the Investigation Phase, in which the players act as a group of investigators from Earth trying to determine 1) why the colony went silent and 2) what happened to the planet’s previous inhabitants.

204451.name: A Hard Goodbye
204451.description:
From the introduction:

In Act One, we get to know the PCs by seeing what their life is like in the organization. We learn more about their Hooks and their Outs. Hooks give a sense of why the characters have stuck with the Organization. Outs are the people who give PCs a reason to get out of the Organization before it’s too late. Act One culminates in a tipping point for each PC - a concrete action that catapults them into the most important decision of their lives.

In Act Two, we turn up the heat. PCs have to choose sides as the actions from Act One come to a head. As the Organization puts pressure on the PCs to uphold their vows, the Outs promise escape and peace. Act Two ends with each character’s fate made clear: freedom, death, or resignation to a life of crime.

Act Three is our epilogue. We learn about the ultimate results of Act Two’s climax. PCs, Outs, and the Organization itself all receive closure in Act Three.

204452.name: Spiral Star
204452.description:
A game about exploring your emotions while at the mercy of callous and obscure supernatural forces

From the introduction:

Spiral Star is a LARP for 8-12 players and one (or more) Moderator. It should take about four hours to play, including character creation.

204453.name: Mein Zombie! Core Rule Book
204453.description:
Description from the publisher:

Mein Zombie is a flexible and expandable 1:1 rule system for recreating the massive Zombie infection. Designed to be used with miniature scales from 15 up to 28mm, it is based around out innovative Drop-In game system. Players from novice to veteran will find it easy to customize the game to their particular gaming style.

This player-friendly approach to war gaming builds around solid and easily learned basic rules, which present an excellent balance of playability and historical accuracy. Once you quickly learn the core rules, you simply "drop in" additional rule modules as you see fit. Each Drop-In utilizes the same terms and mechanics for entirely seamless integration into a full-featured game system.

204454.name: Core Worlds: The Stronghold
204454.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Stronghold is the most powerful ship in the known galaxy.

The Stronghold can simultaneously invade with intense Fleet Strength (5) and Ground Strength (5). When backed up on a variety of unit types, The Stronghold is easier to deploy into the Warzone, so ensure that your commanders are well rounded for battle.

The Stronghold is a promo card for backers of the Core Worlds Digital KS campaign. It was sent to all those who were to receive other physical card rewards from the KS campaign.

204455.name: Untitled (Threeforged Challenge Entry #1566)
204455.description:
From the introduction:

The game is played with two to four players, some paper and pencils and a deck of cards. Give each player one suit from the deck and they turn their ace face-up and leave it in front of them.
...
The game starts by each player choosing a card from their cards, and placing it face-down. If it’s a number, the player will be playing an captive elemental. If it’s a face-card, they’ll play a human scientist. Elementals [try to] figure out what they are, figure the world out, attain freedom. Scientists try to figure elementals out.

204456.name: Shinobi Village
204456.description:
From the introduction:

Shinobi Village is an ensemble game, meaning that each scene features one or more characters from a known cast of characters who appear regularly in the series.

Sometimes a single character will move directly from one scene to the next as though the "camera" was following them.
At other times the "camera" will jump around a lot, showing the actions of many different characters. Everyone gets a chance to add something to every scene. As the group plays out different scenes you will eventually cover everyone in the village (or at least a significant number of them). Just like an animated serial television show, your knowledge of the island and its inhabitants will increase with every session.

204457.name: Bazaar of the Bizarre: From the Forge
204457.description:
From the introduction:

The dwarves of the North are renowned throughout recorded history for their skills at the forge and ability to create weapons, armor and other useful items and imbue them with lasting magic. To this day the “longbeards” of the dwarves pass down tales to their progeny and kin of the wonders created by the Xothol of Ammarindar, the Sevenhammer Forge of Ironstar Mountain or the Flame Vault of the Iron Tower. With the passing of the great dwarven kingdoms, most of these secrets of the forge are lost to the ages although rumors persist of hidden enclaves of dwarves toiling away in deep mountain caverns, undersea tunnels or isolated frosty peaks to create wondrous magic.

User summary:

New magical items, primarily weapons and armors.

204458.name: Artifacts & Legendary Items
204458.description:
From the introduction:

The multiverse has a multitude of pantheons that rule over the different planes of existence, but those who connect themselves most to the material plane are the God’s Council. The council consists of Asmodeus, Archduke of the Nine Hells; Vecna, master lich of the Carcari; Lolth, spider goddess of the demonweb pits of the Abyss; Avandra, goddess of luck and fortune, creator of Bytopia; Melora, goddess of nature, sovereign of the beastlands; and Kord, storm god of Ysguard.

Each of these beings has an artifact weapon that grants immense power to the wielder. It is said these instruments can never truly be destroyed, but lore suggests there are ways, though they may be perilous.

The gods of the council preside over their own realms, but all have connection to the material plane where they are worshiped or feared by the mortals who walk the ground. Shrines and monuments to these deities can be found littering the countryside, and many call to these gods for help in times of great needs, or hardship.

204459.name: Artifacts & Legendary Items Volume II
204459.description:
From the introduction:

Artifacts can be created by both the immortal, and the mortal, but often, it takes immense magical energy to create an artifact, and thus they only appear sparingly in the multiverse, and only very rarely are there more than one of them in existence. Many of these are created in some of the greater planes, outside the material plane like the mithral forge, or the astral sea of Mount Celestia.

Some artifacts are sentient items as well, and often these have complex personalities designed by those who they were created by. These, like other artifacts, are rare, and often the main quest of a troupe of adventurers, or the primary weapon of a villain.

204460.name: Armoury of Enchantment
204460.description:
More Magic Items for 5th Edition

From the introduction:

ontains more than five dozen unique and new magic items suitable for use in any 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons campaign. In order to help you keep things fresh or fit each item into the flavor and background of your campaign, each magic item in this booklet has a few alternate names at the end of its entry, and many of them contain elements or hints of an origin story in their description.

204461.name: Major General: Duel of Time
204461.description:
Description from the publisher:

Well there you go getting yourself involved in a time war. Fortunately, you have the best generals in history on your side. Unfortunately, so does your opponent!

In Major General: Duel of Time, each player has a set of eight Order cards which they play beside the battlefield, overlaying existing orders. All orders for both players that are still showing are resolved after each card is played. Control the most territories at the end of the game to win!

204462.name: Anthony's Armory of Arcana
204462.description:
From the introduction:

Anthony’s Armory of Arcana is a response to fact that the majority of magic weapons in D&D 5th edition are swords of various kinds. Other weapon types, such as axes, maces, hammers, and war mauls have significantly less magical versions and/or are not as powerful as their sword counterparts. Some weapons are not even represented at all, such as Halberds and Flails.

204463.name: Armory Remix (5e)
204463.description:
A re-imagining of the weapons, armor, and shields listed in the D&D 5e Player's Handbook to provide more flavor and variety. Heavily influenced by previous editions, plus some new ideas as well.

Includes:
- New and old weapons like the bastard sword, khopesh, lasso, lucern hammer, man catcher, scythe, and more.
- New armor and shield types like brigandine, banded, field plate, light shields and more.
- New weapon properties like Balanced, Brutal, High Crit, Lunging and more.
- New armor and shield properties like Durable, Tough, Covering, and more.
- Updated tables with full equipment stats and property lists.
- Rules for customizing items to create unique high and low quality items.
- Updated rules for racial and class proficiencies and for feats relating to weapons and armor.

204464.name: Backgrounds Volume 1 (5e)
204464.description:
User summary:

Enumerated and detailed backgrounds include Animal Trainer, Flying Cavalry, Innkeeper, and Teamster. Each background includes several options to further distinguish them.

204465.name: Backgrounds Volume 2 (5e)
204465.description:
User summary:

Enumerated and detailed backgrounds include Artillerist, Escaped Slave, Freeman, High Servant, and Orphan. Each background includes several options to further distinguish them.

204466.description:
Description from the publisher:

A Hunter has set up camp in a dark and dangerous forest. In the middle of the night she is awakened by a sound in the darkness, just outside the light of her small fire. Again! A guttural growl informs the Hunter that she is not alone. To survive this night, the Hunter will need keen wits and sharp aim with her crossbow.

Dark is the Night is a two-player game of hunt-or-be-hunted. One player takes the role of the hunter and can move in the lighted spaces surrounding the campfire while the other player is the monster, secretly moving through the darkness. With only limited tools at their disposal, each player tries to eliminate the other before daybreak.
204466.name: Dark Is The Night

204467.name: Pegasus (Issue 21 - Mar 2012)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204467.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 21
Mars 2012

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

boardgamepublisher: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
204468.description:
Description from the publisher:

Expansion for the Statecraft political card game system that introduces two new card types, Assets and Agents.
204468.name: Statecraft: the Political Card Game – Assets & Agents

204469.name: Pegasus (Issue 22 - Jun 2012)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204469.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 22
Juni 2012

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204470.name: The Stygian Society
204470.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Stygian Society is a diceless dungeon crawl. Heroes work together to climb the cube tower, eliminating enemies as they work their way to the top and the tower's master!

Players drop cubes into the tower based on which skills they select but also cubes for the enemies. Both players and the enemies act based on what drops out the bottom. Strong strategic team play will be critical to make it to the tower's top floor.

204471.name: Magnificent Artefacts
204471.description:
(publisher blurb)

The world is a dangerous place, so you will need all the help you can get to stay alive. Fortunately the world is full of ancient items imbued with strange magic just waiting for any warren raider to discover. Magnificent Artefacts is a supplement for minimalist fantasy game In Darkest Warrens, containing 33 new magical items in two sheets of A4, arranged into tables perfect for random rolls. From an amulet that allows the wearer to become a mouse on command, to gloves that shoot bees, this new supplement is a must-have for adventurers.

boardgamepublisher: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
204472.description:
Description from the publisher:

A 1-6 player cooperative game of terrifying cave escape. Players take the role of amateur cavers attempting to escape an unexplored network of subterranean tunnels, before the lights flicker out or the darker things beneath the Earth catch up to them...

In Sub Terra players spend their turn exploring and revealing the tunnel system around them, attempting to survive the various perils of the cave, from floods and cave ins to gas leaks and scree. Players each have a role which gives them specialist abilities, such as an Engineer with dynamite to blast a new route or a Scout to find a route more easily.

New tiles are placed from a randomised stack of cave features, which determines whether you'll be hit with a dead end or a range of new options.

At the end of each turn, players face the reality of their situation, with a hazard card drawn to determine what danger causes them damage or cuts off their way out of the horror below.

These cards are finite, and when they run out, your torches flicker and the air feels tight, and your chance of survival diminishes quickly.
204472.name: Sub Terra
boardgamepodcastepisode: 26 Devon Dice podcast season 2 Sub Terra, sub DOOM and sub monsters
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 037 – Top 10 Publishers

204473.name: Pegasus (Issue 23 - Oct 2012)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204473.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 23
Oktober 2012

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

204474.name: Bones of Chinatown
204474.description:
(publisher blurb)

In The Bones of Chinatown, the pulp world of the 1930s is in danger! The dread Chinese sorcerer and mastermind Gao Fang is on the verge of obtaining god-like mystical power, the Ruby Eyes of the Lo-Man Tiger. Only a ragtag group of heroes stands between the safety of humanity and Gao Fang’s control over the laws of time and space. But do they have what it takes to traverse through the bowels of San Francisco’s Chinatown and into the very heart of the villain’s lair? Can they stop a Chinese mastermind from holding nigh unlimited power? This serial is not for the faint of heart!

This 9-page adventure utilizes the Savage Worlds rules system and takes place in the gritty pulp world popularized by the likes of Raymond Chandler and Dashiell Hammett, thus offering a different feel than the standard fantasy dungeon crawl.

204475.name: Tibbits
204475.description:
Tibbits is a variation and combination of several games - but played with cubes. The cubes have A, K & Q on them (like cards) and in different colors. You try to build combinations (like 3 identical As, A-K-Q of the same color, etc.) and collect chips based on what colors and combinations you make. Ages 8 and up. There is also a colors-only version of game play for younger players.

The game is packaged in a lidded plastic dice cup and comes with 3 Tibbit Cubes, 60 chips, & instructions.

204476.name: King of Icefang Pass
204476.description:
(publisher blurb)

Each year only a few caravans choose to brave the Icefang Mountains. This year, fewer still. Seems the last two merchants to attempt the route never returned and there’s rumor that a new king has claimed the pass.

King of Icefang Pass is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

This adventure is part of our Dungeons of Dazegoneby series, a new line of products created with ‘old school’ gaming in mind. If you like this adventure watch for other Dungeons of Dazegoneby mini-dungeons coming soon.

204477.name: Pegasus (Issue 24 - Dec 2012)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204477.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 24
Desember 2012

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser
204478.description:
Pegasus
Utgave Nr. 25
Mars 2013

Note - The PDF version is paginated with "two-up" formatting.

"Fantasy / Sci-Fi / Tegneserier / Laiv / Miniatyr / Rollespill / Brettspill / Kort / Data / Film"

204479.name: Pegasus (Issue 26 - Oct 2013)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204480.name: Pegasus (Issue 27 - Dec 2013)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204481.name: Pegasus (Issue 28 - Apr 2014)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204482.name: Pegasus (Issue 29 - Autumn 2014)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204483.name: Pegasus (Issue 30 - Spring 2015)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204484.name: Pegasus (Issue 31 - Autumn 2015)
rpgpublisher: N4F: Norsk Forbund For Fantastiske Fritidsinteresser

204485.name: NeoNihon Quickstart
204485.description:
(publisher's blurb)

Welcome to NeoNihon

The Japanese colonization ship landed on the extra-solar planet of Shi Tateyama in 2236. Like the other corporate nation-states fleeing old earth, Japan used remote planetary surveys to target their colonization efforts. This planet seemed to be just what they were looking for; a paradise with abundant water, a comfortable climate and a vibrant biosphere. Once the colonists awoke from their decade-long cryofreeze, they found the planet was far less pleasant than planetary surveys indicated. It was a planet of extreme mountains, nearly boiling sea-level temperatures and harsh, corrosive tempests. The rain corroded most metal and unusual electromagnetic characteristics at sea level fried most electronics. The Colonial Board of Directors made the decision to settle on the cooler, dryer, and safer mountain peaks, with each corporation founding their own colony.

The planet was poor in metals, with the rain dissolving most of the natural ore deposits. Earth-born livestock couldn’t survive and the only arable land was in the harsh lowlands. The scientists produced genetically engineered humans called henomin to labour for the colonies. These henomin were sent down to the lowlands to grow rice, extract protein from the seas, and grow iron-hard black bamboo. Wandering, devout androids delivered messages between villages, shrines, and great colony.

204486.name: Psycheball
204486.description:
From the introduction:

Outside the Arena, Psycheball players deliberately undermine their own lives. The best players have the most personal problems and emotional struggles to deal with. The turmoil of their life provides mental fuel for their powers in the Arena. To succeed at the game, players sabotage their relationships and hurt those they love, or are hurt by them instead.

With the MeatPuppet of your physical body forgotten in some remote room, its input diminished by hard drugs and soft restraints, the virtual body of your Avatar and impressions of the Arena fill your senses. The lights dim. A spotlight hits you. Around the Arena, other spots reveal the Avatars of your opponents. The buzzer sounds. Remember your training. Aim for your opponents’ subconscious, and guard your mind from attack. The whole network is watching.

204487.name: The Rending of the Veil
204487.description:
From the introduction:

Thousands of years ago, a slumbering assortment of human refugees was brought to a lifeless frozen planet by an enormous space ark. Clouds of terraforming nanotech were seeded into the planet’s weak atmosphere. Over the course of a few decades, the frozen world grew warm and vibrant with plant and animal life, just like the distant Earth that humanity had left behind. The ark’s advanced A.I.—after overseeing the terraforming process—woke its human cargo and sent them down to the planet’s surface, beginning the story of humanity anew on an alien world both familiar and strange.

Rather than living in unity, humans soon fragmented into a number of warring kingdoms, the majority of which returned to a feudal existence based on technologies they could build with their hands: agriculture, masonry, metalworking, and so on. The nanotech clouds, space ark, orbital A.I., and other unseen wonders became the stuff of myth and legend. Only a few small enclaves—hidden on mountain peaks and in secret valleys—maintained expertise in advanced technology, allowing a select group of people known as the Lumen to live extremely long lives thanks to seemingly magical devices.

204488.name: Life As It Was
204488.description:
From the introduction:

Life as it Was is a storygame for three to five players, one of whom will play as the GM. The game follows a group of survivors, all children. The world has just suffered a cataclysmic pandemic which has left only children between the ages of roughly 8 and 12. We will see if the group can survive the next several weeks, and withstand an attack by a roving gang. After the attack, we have a brief epilogue and then the game ends.

204489.name: The Coven: A Game of Bargains
rpg: The Coven: A Game of Bargains
204489.description:
From the introduction:

The Coven is a role-playing game about some outside, Other force that is trying to enter and destroy the world through its interactions with occultists who, against their better judgment, interact and bargain with the Other for their own benefit. In the game, one player will take on the role of an outside Other force, be that the forces of hell, an alien incursion, Mythos gods, etc., as they attempt to enter and destroy the town that the coven have unwittingly invited them into. The rest of the players will make up members of the Coven, people who on the surface are normal townsfolk, but all of whom have a secret desire for power that gets them into trouble.

204490.name: Rainbow Roll
204490.description:
Description from the designer:

Rainbow Roll is a push your luck dice game for 2-4 players. Players roll a pair of dice with numbered and colored faces. They must then flip over a tile corresponding to one of the numbers or colors shown. Each tile has sushi on the backside. The more sushi showing the more points earned!

204491.description: Bait and Switch is a poker style card game with cute cuddly sea creatures and deep deep decisions. A variation on 7 Card Stud, players discard cards from their hand to manipulate which cards they may use from the center. Bait and Switch is extremely easy to learn and teach. Poker players will find the game rich in depth and decision space. Optional family friendly rules make it a fantastic game for teaching poker concepts.
204491.name: Bait and Switch

204492.name: Emergency Dispatch
204492.description:
Description from the designer:

Disasters have befallen Metro City and it's up to the fine folks of the Emergency Dispatch Center to save the day!

Emergency Dispatch is a fast paced co-operative set collection dice game for 2-6 players. Players move colored dice representing various types of emergency equipment around a map of a city. Tiles are placed representing emergency calls that need to be answered. The emergencies are resolved by rolling the dice to get the required combination of symbols. Successfully resolving emergencies earns players bonuses that will help them on future calls. The game is won by solving a minimum number of emergencies over 8 turns without accruing 8 failures.

204493.description: Sakura Arms — known in Japanese as 桜降る代に決闘を — is a two-player dueling game in which players first choose two of six megamis (Japanese goddesses), each of which has a different special power. Players then see what the opponent chose before assembling a deck of ten out of 22 cards, with the players choosing cards both to take advantage of their own megami powers and to defend against the opponent's. Players then duel to see who will be victorious.
204493.name: Sakura Arms

204494.name: Shires
204494.description:
Description from the designer:

The King has died leaving no heirs. A great election is to be held to determine the throne. As an ambitious noble you must use your diplomatic prowess, economic wit, and (if all else fails) military might to secure the votes of enough Shires to garner the crown.

Shires is an epic 4X strategy game for 3-5 players. The layout of the board, buildings, fields, and armies in each shire vary from game to game. A blend of map generation, resource management, negotiation, backstabbing, and simple combat make Shires an engaging game with an always climatic conclusion.

204495.name: Empires of the Clouds
204495.description:
Description from the designer:

Empires of the Clouds is a worker placement game for 2-4 players. Players take control of an airship company during the golden age of aviation. Each round players will upgrade their airships, research new technologies, seek out investors, woo clients, and fill their passenger manifests. At the conclusion of each round the airships take flight. Players earn points and cash by completing flights and manipulating passenger manifests.

204496.description:
In Villannex, each player receives six cards which mostly show buildings, plus two production cards which can be used to produce either the products on the left side of a card or the products on the right.

Now each player chooses four of the six cards and shows them to everyone. Then, each player simultaneously picks two cards and puts them on the table, deciding whether to produce the left or the right products. Finally, each village (consisting of two cards) is scored. Each card has a text explaining the points it yields, sometimes depending on one's own products or everyone else's or a mixture of these. The highest scoring village wins.

From the rules:
A couple of villages are about to be annexed, and the mayors have gathered for a friendly meeting.
As the liquor goes down, one of them starts to brag about his village. And the others can’t just sit there and listen. One thing beats the next, and the alcohol helps them exaggerate. In the end, the mayors end up having a match for who’ll be the next mayor. Whoever has the best developed village, whoever uses their resources best will be the winner! And as you know, that’s your village. You just have to show the others!
204496.name: Villannex (2nd Edition + expansions)

204497.name: Captain Conspiracy (Supers!)
204497.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up of Captain Conspiracy. An agent of a secret society dedicated to bringing about a New World Order. The society uses the Captain as a tool to spread terror and mistrust across the world. When not acting publicly, he uses his abilities to assassinate key officials to destabilize world governments.

204498.name: Match Madness
204498.description:
Description from the publisher:

Be the fastest to recreate with your blocks the pattern shown on a card to win the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Each player receives a set of 5 blocks numbered 1 to 5.
After shuffling the deck of pattern cards, players determine how many rounds they wish to play and take the same number of pattern cards from the top of the deck. These cards are then placed, face down, in the center of the table.

Game play:
The top card from the deck is flipped revealing a pattern. All players scramble to match, with their blocks, the pattern shown on the card. The first player to successfully match the pattern grabs the card and shows to the other players that the configuration of their blocks matches the pattern on the card. If the player is correct, they keep the card. A new card is flipped over and another round begins.

The game ends when all the cards have been collected by the players. The player with the most cards wins. In the case of a tie, the player with the most level 5 cards wins (if players have the same number of level 5 cards, then level 4 cards are counted and so forth).

204499.name: Loot Hero DX
204499.description:
User Summary

Run across the screen, defeating monsters and gaining upgrades, until you meet bigger monsters.

204500.name: Skirmish Maps
204500.description:
From publisher blurb:

Skirmish maps provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting game set in WWII (or weird war). It consists of GM’s notebook as well as stylized handouts which can be printed and presented to players.

Please note that the supplement is stat free and can be used in any WWII or modern game.

The supplement consists of 8 skirmish maps such as e.g.:

Destroyed Sherman tank map
Fortified cannon position map
Spotter camp map
Farm map
and more....




Each map consists of:

its own briefing papers for GM,
top down view map,
